Review.Titre: Baid and Switch Tactics, Doggy Business Practices
Review.Contenu: It is a horrible experience, they use bait and switch tactics with their package sales, show you one price and then you receive an invoice that is 2x higher—horrible customer service with their billing team. AVOID. They act like some doggy scammers, I am cancelling all of my products with them and advise anyone looking for a good hosting provider to don't even look at DreamHost.

These reviews are woefully out of date. They have increased all their prices, and deprecated many services, so I cancelled. They charged a $20 "free domain registration fee" which is completely fraudulent -- that domain was supposed to be included with the paid hosting. Avoid Dreamhost like the plague.

Review.Titre: Dreamhost has deceptive practices with product packaging
Review.Contenu: Dreamhost has deceptive practices with packaging their product so that the user is forced to buy add-ons. A 3-rd party included feature initially available suddenly becomes unavailable and prompts you to upgrade.  Also in spite of my warning not to do it they canceled my email hosting for which I paid separately.

Dreamhost is not what it used to be. It is expensive, their pricing is outrageous. No network or any type of defense. Domain prices are also high. DH stated to look like GoDaddy and their crap.You tell support about a problem with their software and they don't care.

I am very dissatisfied with this company. I do not recommend buying from them.They did not keep their promises and deceived me.They have a terrible chat support team. They were rude, abusive, and threatened to harm me and my data. They did not provide any assistance or guidance. The documentation was unclear and confusing. The live chat was always busy and delayed. When I finally got connected, the chat person was not knowledgeable or helpful. When they realized that they could not set up the server, they became hostile and offensive. After that, they blocked me from the chat. That means I cannot get any support. How can I get help then? They do not respect my data privacy. They have access to it and they always monitor it. They also asked me to share it for marketing purposes and stole it from me.

It was ok service that was a bit expensive for my needs.Upon moving to a different hosts during the last month of my prepaid 3-year plan, I got charged $20 as an outstanding balance and domain registration fee. I had no domain left with Dreamhost and my plan was fully paid to the end. This was just Dreamhost extracting money from customers that were no longer satisfied with them.Predatory cancellation charges are odious.

1 star because customer service was approachable.  Else it would zero stars! The most annoying customer service I have ever experienced. I hosted my wordpress website; and its usually down multiple times a day, every day a week. Whenever I contact them, they say hold on we will look into it; and suddenly website goes live. And im told clear cache! although its down for everyone!!!they suggest to check downforeveryoneorjustme.com; but dont trust the outcome from it.if u r looking for a serious shared hosting. stay away. its a nightmarehost.com dont expect a good dream out of it.And the best part - they sell you crap hosting with a so-called free domain; and when you ask for refund for such a crap hosting. They give you deducted money for an overcharged domain (17.99 usd).HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED

Review.Titre: The support did not help me
Review.Contenu: I tried twice to create an account and it was not approved This company is unprofessional and their support is not good If you try to create an account, your funds will be suspended and they will not approve your account without any reason You will not find anyone to tell you the reason for that

Hosting is ridiculously slow, unusable slow. If you are even considering using dreamhost for ecommerce i would steer clear completely. Customer service response to the slowness was to pay more for a more expensive service. It would be manageable if the hosting somewhat worked but it can take around 5 minutes to load a page if it loads at all!

Automated billing is wrong. No offer or agreement was made to bill me for additional php support, in which there was nothing additional about it. Not only that since the payment was unknown and overdue it then blocked other parts of my account until the "extortion" payment was made.

Review.Titre: Back up everything yourself - Dreamhost might 'lose' your site
Review.Contenu: Tech staff were unable to find the database for one of my longstanding Wordpress sites.  It had disappeared. A quote from the email - "We checked with our system administrators and admins, but there is no trace for the database to being removed from our side, however, we continue investigating this case as it is pretty strange a situation..."

Review.Titre: Don't charge money if you haven't set account
Review.Contenu: Don't charge money if you haven't set up account.It's such a bizarre experience that I bought a WordPress hosting and I was of the impression that I will add domain (which I bought from another party) and start right away.Guess what? DreamHost happily charges money and after charges money says that your account needs approval. Why don't you approve the account in the first place before charging money?

You 'lost' the database for one of my Wordpress sites. You couldn't give me an explanation. I had to rebuild all the pages as a static site using waybackmachine. You made no apology and took no responsibility.

I made an account and I had an issue with my credit card.After a week I solved it and paid them but suddenly they sent me an email that they rejected my account without saying why and I have to wait three days to give my money.Very bad experience.

Review.Titre: Very slow download and transfer system within the hosting.
Review.Contenu: I have never seen a stupider platform in my life, just so you know, if you want to unzip a 25mb file inside cpanel, it will take you maybe 1 hour. Also if you use filezilla and other tools. The mouths until they introduce a normal cpanel and speed up the work process inside the host should be bypassed in a wide arc.

Review.Titre: 14 years of them having the wrong email address for me.
Review.Contenu: Been a customer of Dreamost for nearly 14 years. They keep switching my primary email to an old one I haven't had for about 12 years. Now my account is suspended over a $5 charge. Can't reach support, can't log into their panel, can't reset the password because the email I have been using to log in for 14 years 'is not on file.'I think 14 years of patience is enough to say this: "Will they get their act together?"

Frequent downtime issues, currently experiencing over 2 hours of downtime. An hour ago, they assured me it wouldn't be much longer, but this kind of situation occurs at least once every month or two. I'm actively looking for another company to switch to once my services are finally back up and running, which is unfortunate

lots of downtime, right now going on 2 hours and counting. an hour ago they said "not much longer" - this happens at least once every month or two. finding another company to move to, when my services are finally back up and working sadly.

Review.Titre: We have brought over 100 customers to…
Review.Contenu: We have brought over 100 customers to dreamhost by recommending hosting after building the website, but now we regret it. For 2 days we faced the SSL issue on all staging domains, we wasted a lot of time going back and forth with support and they were unable to solve the issue on their side. We will definitely move to another hosting provider.

Review.Titre: They didn't have any backups of my…
Review.Contenu: They didn't have any backups of my sites when I needed them. My Wordpress sites were all deleted and I was told there was a problem with backups on my server so there was nothing they could do. "No guarantees" they said. Three backups were listed, but they were either empty or non-existant.

Review.Titre: paid for 24 hour service, got 106 hour service.
Review.Contenu: paid for 24 hour service on Thursday. Didn't receive request/list of needs from contractor until Friday morning. Responded with necessary plugin files via google drive by Friday midday. Site was not back online until Monday, and child theme and other simple pieces were not installed/activated. When questioned on delays, they blamed me, despite my .

We’re really disappointed with Dreamhost. We recently found out one of our sites wasn’t in use and yet they’ve been billing us for years.  When we raised the matter they showed no interest and were unwilling to consider our longevity of relationship - simply hiding behind their T&Cs.  Outcome is that they had 3 websites (and we’re planning some more) and now we’re switching elsewhere.  The dream turned sour.  You have been warned.

DreamHost wasn’t so Dreamy! I was with DreamHost for several years always having issues with the uptime of my sites. While I had an entry level Virtual Private Server (VPS) with DreamHost, I had never had an issue like this with my previous VPS providers. Trouble tickets were created with DreamHost Support over the years and I would always follow any advice to optimize the speed of the processor and/or RAM usage, however nothing seemed to change the performance of my sites on their VPS. Also, just because you purchased a VPS with DreamHost does not mean that your SQL databases will run on it. I’m pretty sure they are still using shared hosting for your SQL databases and they upsell you to move them over to a faster VPS.In addition to the uptime issues, they kept raising their rates on a VPS that was not working properly and auto renewing my contract. If you don’t cancel your auto renewing VPS subscription in time, they will charge you for everyday that it is open or running, so be sure to backup your sites and cancel or close your VPS before the plan auto renews.If you are looking for a VPS I would do your research because hosting companies have a huge markup on their products. I would recommend looking at a VPS like AWS Lightsail. It may take a little more work and education on the platform to get started however in the long run you will understand how a VPS works with a lower overall expense.  I hope this helps someone that has had the same experience that I have had with DreamHost.
I lost my entire website because of the cache enable feature. It deleted my entire website, and they didn't have a backup, not even a 2 month backup.

Please allow up to 48 hours for any pending charges to be removed from your bank statement.We apologize that we weren't able to accept your business, and we wish you the best of luck in your search for a web host.Thanks,The DreamHost Approvals Team---- ITS FIRST MINUTE I STARTED, I CANT IMAGINE WHAT A PERSON GO THROUGH IN TIME WITH THIS ABSOLUTELY ABUSIVE AND DISCRIMINATORY PRACTICES, THEY LITERALLY BLOCK ME WITHOUT NO REASON PROVIDED, SO INSULTING AND DISCRIMINATORY

Review.Titre: I like Dreamhost, but avoid their pro services
Review.Contenu: I like Dreamhost a lot, but I would not use their pro services again. The site transfer was fine, but they gave me bad instructions for the DNS updates. My site and email were down for a while before I realized. Then I got more (and more) bad instructions. I finally just Googled the answers and did it myself. Basically, it was a net productivity loss and waste of money.

Review.Titre: So this review is for Cat V
Review.Contenu: So this review is for Cat V. who was trying to upsell me on email as an answer to my question why the price was increased from $12 to $20 a month automatically, they want to move me to a $200+ a year. I asked for a refund on 30th of December for the month, I don't think I asked to be connected to sales but to billing.

Once you signup - you are trapped. The low price and money back guarantee are there to trap you in. Once in, you basically cant get out without you loosing the money.They have this offer of 97 days money back guarantee -"DreamHost offers a full refund on Shared Hosting fees if your plan is canceled within the first 97 days of opening the account. This applies to monthly and annual plans."Guess what - if you get a plan with free domain - you basically can't cancel the plan event though you no longer need the domain/haven't registered it. You either have to pay for the domain or keep the hosting plan. For me, keeping the hosting plan was cheaper, otherwise I'd to cancel  the plan with no refund for it, and pay 5 dollar extra for the domain. I am trapped.Yes, they have the info sneaked on the knowledge base, we are to blame for not reading it  - IK

Review.Titre: I was with Dreamhost for a very long…

Review.Contenu: 🚨 READ THIS CAREFULLY:  Right after creating my account, paying for the domain and the plan (fortunately I decided to start with a monthly plan so it wasn't enough), they blocked my account. Also for existing customers, who tells you that you're not gonna have the same destiny with your next monthly/yearly payment? Which means losing your website in a second.Good luck with these scammers.
Service is down? Under maintenance? Who knows. Recently the speed has been awful.

Disgusting. They stopped my website without any warning, because I had huge traffic. I couldn't know my website will scale that much in one day.If you have scalable website, don't use them.Total scam, my loss is about $150.

Dreamhost is absolutely terrible.  I have a half dozen occurrences where their inept tech support has brought down websites, for long periods of time, with no warning, no notification.   They are clearly not aware of the technology, and can't fix a wet noodle.  I have all but had it with them, after this latest occurrence.  Currently, we have a service that checks IMAP.  That service got approval from Dreamhost and we purchased their VPS.  Note: IMAP is a service that reads mail, but we are banned because of SPAM. Getting backups of the files proved unfruitful, and restoring these files were of little use without having a SUDO account. The resulting downtime lasted over a month before they did anything.Lastly, I had a number of other clients have significant downtime due to Bluehost.  The above claims are not the only ones I have.

We have many large domains on Dreamhost and around 50 normal domains. A few days ago Dreamhost sent us a notice to say we were violating their AUP by hosting a bunch of files on our domain that were orphaned. We checked within minutes, and all files are properly linked and are active, being accessed regularly by viewers. I wrote back and told Dreamhost this. Then we wrote again providing even more information. we waited for a reply. We have now received two more replies same as the first one, all identical, saying we were in AUP violation by hosting these files. We wrote two more times. Dreamhost will not respond in any way except to continue repeating the same AUP violation email. Obviously, this is nuts, and we are left to conclude that DreamHost has been taken over by crazy woke millennials. Since Dreamhost steadfastly refuses to respond in any logical manner, we are now going to the following agencies with our complaints, including but not limited to, TrutPilot, the attorney general, the FTC, and many others. If they forcibly remove valid, linked content, saying they are orphaned, we will turn it over to the attorneys and tell them to get in into court no matter what it takes. Clearly, there is something wrong with Dreamhost's people. Clearly. In 20 years with Dreamhost, they have become flakier and flakier. Now they appear to be not only utterly worthless, but a true financial liability as well.

It is not possible to contact the support service on the website. There is no email to support option (there is no support service email address). There is an option to leave a ticket, but it does not work either.  There is only a chatbot, which also does not work.Terrible service.

Review.Titre: same case handled by different staff
Review.Contenu: My blog theme had been customized for over 10 years, and it was working fine. However, a few days ago, I encountered an issue where the dreamhost informed me that one of the folders had reached its storage limit, which prevented me from publishing new posts. They deleted the old backup and restored the data, but unfortunately, the work I had done in the past few days was lost. Although the homepage appeared perfect and intact, when I clicked on a post link, it displayed a blank page and indicated that the theme directory did not exist.I contacted the support team and provided specific links, but each time I received a response from a new person who didn't read the chat history. They either seemed too busy to address the problems I mentioned or provided incorrect replies intended for other customers. In the meantime, I discovered that my theme had been switched to another theme by DreamHost (possibly for testing purposes). I immediately switched back to my original theme, only to realize that I could no longer customize it. The theme was too old, the developer was no longer available, and it wasn't compatible with the current WordPress system. In summary, I now need to choose and purchase a new theme and seek customization. Currently, my blog looks very unattractive, and it seems like I might have to abandon all the work I have done for this blog over the past 16 years.The main point is that it would be more effective for both parties if the same person could follow a case, so I wouldn't have to explain everything from the beginning again. This would also help resolve the issues more efficiently. I feel extremely frustrated right now.

I received a receipt confirming payment, but nowhere on the receipt did it indicate what it was for. Logging into DreamHost's panel wasn't any more helpful. Just indicated a payment but no explanation, so the receipt is worse than useless. HMRC will question this, and unless detail is written on it, I won't be able to provide answers, so they'd probably disallow it.So the issue is despite paying the renewal fee, the domain remains set to expire in a few days!!!!!Absolute pile of crap to be honest. Typical 'take your money' and don't actually do what you paid them. I clicked Renew against this domain so there's no possibility of mistake on my part.I spoke with an agent via web chat who couldn't see any evidence of the renewal and couldn't explain what was going on. He had to 'email' the 'team' hoping for a response. Really?! I mean the incompetence is spreading. They shouldn't be allowed to take money if it's not allocated to a service. Stealing money from ≠customers is probably not your best policy!Dreamhost: sort this out and explain why this has happened. The way things are, I am not now planning to renew hosting and may take all my domains and hosting elsewhere and claim a full refund of ALL payments. And that will be a minimum. I may seek legal retribution for this inexcusable incompetence. Really incensed by your incompetence.

I have been a loyal Dreamhost customer for nearly 18 years, and have owned or managed a number of Dreamhost accounts, and countless domains and websites over the years. They were simply the best. No problems, and support was as swift as it was smart. In short, Dreamhost was a dream!But that dream turned into a nightmare this year, when my busiest and most crucial domain was hijacked. And in my hour of need, Dreamhost support failed me completely. Nobody could explain the problem to me or how long it would or could take to fix. I asked for help from a supervisor on multiple occasions, and was told nobody knew when their supervisor was coming back to work next.Worst of all, with all their support now coming from overseas, the first hour or so of every interaction involved me trying over and over again to explain the problem to someone who just couldn't understand me (and who I couldn't understand in return). By the time support did finally understand what as going on, I was in tears and ready to give up - only to discover that it would take another 1-4 hours for them to tell me they didn't know.In total, I spent roughly 14 hours over 4 days trying to restore my domain and email and associated services. All the while dealing with an uncaring, unresponsive, and lethargic support team who would rather fob me off  to the incoming day/night shift than alay my concerns.I'm in the process of transferring all 20+ domains and websites out of Dreamhost now. Customer support is critical when it comes to web hosting and Dreamhost just doesn't care about their customers anymore.

Review.Titre: I am very much disappointed with…
Review.Contenu: I am very much disappointed with DreamHost hosting. Recently I have purchased "Shared Unlimited" hosting plan from dreamhost and paid the amount through my debit card and the transaction was successful; and as soon as I made the payment, they disabled my account and shown a message that we cannot approve your account and the payment you made is voided some thing like that I didn't remember the message., but I lost my money. I have sent a mail regarding to the dream host team and asked for refund but again and again they are replying with the same message that we cannot approve you account and your payment is voided bla bla bla.. it's almost 10 days over, I didn't get my money back.. they are not providing the hosting account but they have taken my money.. not refunding it.. I have tried many ways to get my money back, no use... it may be a reputed but for me they have done cheating... I don't recommend dreamhost to newbies...Regards,Sandeep Kumar,WordPress Developer,Kartisoft Inc. India.

BlueHost sucks!Since transferring my hosting account to BlueHost, my site has not been operable. Just remember that they will not give any refunds after 15 days, even if your site wasn't live due to their faulty servers. Extremely disappointed in their customer service.

Review.Titre: Do Not Give This Company Your Business
Review.Contenu: Do not use this company for your hosting or any services.  I was a client for years, until issues started happening this summer, with outages after outages... then last month on Oct 27th, the company does a server upgrade, which causes more issues with my hosting clients... and then they refuse to provide a refund.  They are quick to show you their terms.  I contacted their support through chat, who suggested that I need to close my hosting services then request a refund.  So I did, and then Billing emails me saying, because I closed/canceled my services they can't give me a refund.  How missed up is that.... do not host with them... take your business elsewhere... shady

Review.Titre: Don't believe a word of their marketing
Review.Contenu: This company's strategy is clear: they lure you in with a Wordpress offer on "Shared servers" that is absolutely unable to sustain any website whatsoever. I have been struggling with downtimes, even though I run perhaps the most basic website ever, and I have great scores on websites like GTMetrix. The servers simply crash, randomly, almost every day. Their answer? "Oh it sounds like you need to pay four times as much and get a dedicated server, your website needs that". Does it? A BASIC website, with less than 500 visitors per day and no fancy features? Of course, they do know that changing hosting is time-consuming and they take advantage of that. Despicable business strategy, really.So, in short, avoid Dreamhost. Run for the hills.

Review.Titre: Locked out, ignored, unable to transfer away...
Review.Contenu: Just awful. Worst hosting experience of my life. Their firewalls are tuned up so high they ended up blocking my home IP.  Locked out of all my sites after more than a week. No help from support. Finally gave up, since it's clear I am never getting my files or data from them.  My IP is still blocked with no way to retrieve them.  Forced to completely rebuild my business from scratch elsewhere.AND can't transfer away the handful of domains I registered there. Every code they send me is wrong.Just embarrassing that any modern host could be so bad.  They must pay a fortune in affiliate commissions to push this junk.
Very bad experience, getting 500 errors constantly. Support team and sys admins not efficient
After buying a domain name, I had to pay even more to be able to use it
alphabet people - what more can I say.

I am a 6 months client of their server (shared hosting and domain) All I can say it's the most horrible hosting I ever had. My website is down because of their server at list once per month. In July 3 times it was down. I plan to move to a different provider.

SEE OVER 200 1 Star Reviews on TrustPilot!! - I have hosted with Dream Host for over a decade. At first, they were amazing with support and service; speedy load times, etc.However; when I signed up all those years ago, I was given a "discounted" rate of $5/month with unlimited everything, including unlimited hosted domains.They said it was not a discount gimmick, but would stay that price until I decided to discontinue my hosting plan.Over the past few years, not only have my servers been bogged down to where my Web sites were taking a considerably embarrassing amount of time to load (in front of clients, many times) - but they obviously hired a bunch of challenged individuals for tech support that don't have a clue how to talk to customers, provide prompt service or make things happen like they used to do.I have literally had techs just go in the back of my system for me many times and fix issues that they could see, without requiring me to do it.This was amazing customer support (THEN, not now), where they saw an issue on their end and fixed it.Recently, these lazy techs they have working for them now have found issues, after making me wait for a unnecessary amount of time - but instead of just clicking a button to fix it - send me in circles to figure out how to get to the same page they were on, expecting me to fix it, myself.Not only have these unprofessional NEW techs made getting help a huge nightmare, but they have redesigned their pages and navigation of the admin sections so confusing, you can't find anything that would sensibly be found in an ordinarily expected menu heading, sub menu or button.But my biggest problem was when I found out I was being billed $15/month for my $5/month hosting plan, without any prior notice - and against the agreement I initially signed up for over a decade ago - where I was told it would stay at the $5/month fee until I discontinued my plan.When confronting them about this, they made excuses, but wouldn't show me any agreement that stated they could change my plan to another rate, or where I had agreed to such changes.Instead of putting me back on my same payment plan, they said "We feel like we are offering our customers a great value as we keep upgrading things to make our services better."That's bull-crap corporate (greedy) lingo for "We know you were fine with what you were getting, but to justify our desire to buy more stuff and increase our CE0's take home check, etc - we are going to force a full $10 extra per month on you, without prior notice, without proof of an agreement when you signed up (that says we can and you agree to let us)".Even a few years ago I was blown away to see them try a sneaky approach to get new sign ups by stating "$4/month hosting, unlimited everything".But after being funneled through a cleverly crafted slew of pages and drivel about their amazing features, you end up finding out that $4/month fee is only available if you pay for THREE full years at sign up!I am tired of their excuses and nonsense. I refuse to pay anyone more if I didn't agree to such increases and they cannot provide me any proof that their agreement with me gave them the right to do so in the future.Today, I tried to change the DNS of my domains on Dreamhost (NightmareHost) to another hosting company.They literally blocked my access to do so; in other words, holding my domains that I already paid fees to use, hostage, wanting me to pay them the extra monthly fees that they FORCED on me without ANY NOTICE.The online tech even told me "It shouldn't be blocked, you should have access to change the DNS".Funny how after I asked him about this hostage situation, the BUTTON in my admin page all-of-a-sudden became clickable to get to the DNS page.I asked if he did that, he admitted he did turn it on and then told me I could change the DNS, as I had a right to do so.But when I clicked "change DNS" when putting in the new hosting DNS info, it blocked me with "You don't have permission to do that!"I asked him why??? He had me wait while he "looked into it", then came back to the chat window and said "unfortunately, access to your DNS is part of our hosting plan".REALLY??????!!!! They make money from my domain registration fees, but can block me from pointing them to another host because I don't agree to pay their incredibly high jacked up price on my hosting plan?The emails I have used for bank accounts, etc are under the domain they are holding hostage.I smell a big rat with all of the 4+ ratings on this Trust Pilot Web site, as I know other people are tired of this company's downhill fall in quality, outsourcing their tech support to other countries, etc.I don't trust these reviews being real customers, but insiders trying to hide the truth.I CANNOT recommend this hosting company! GREEDY hostage holding thugs that don't care about anything but the CASH!

Review.Titre: Website down for 2 weeks right after starting
Review.Contenu: After being up for less than a week, the website was down for over 2 weeks with no idea when it would be restored, due to a Dreamhost issue. This was confirmed to be an issue where their server crashed and was not at all in our control. This is completely unacceptable from any hosting provider, no matter how cheap. Dreamhost managed to fail in a manner worse than I ever imagined. We eventually gave up and switched provider.

Review.Titre: unfortunately i was fall into a trap…
Review.Contenu: unfortunately i was fall into a trap with this company i never used them, i pay for hosting it was offer for one year 35$ and after payment they say we don't support your business and i don't know what they mean by business because I didn't include any business information and they are not a payment gateway i didn't even know why they refuse am shocked, and now they took my money they didn't issue any refund to me , am just surprised how bad they are , and am not sure even if this reviews they have is real because i got scammed by this company.

Review.Titre: The correct name should be NighmareHost
Review.Contenu: The correct name should be Nighmare HostDozens of tickets about uptime, lost connection and other problems with Web servicesAfter two YEARS! reporting the problems and hearing back: "Is normal in our end", they realize their apache was freezing. Thy are incompetent and blame the customerThey change their policy and apply for older services.You have a service? Thay changed the policy after you are using? "So bad, you can pay for the new plan"Recently they blamed me for taking too much database storage (for a database created when the policy had no limit, but ok...). The database had 2.5GB, they "specialist" said it was 6GB and I need to fix or they will migrate my plan. TWO MONTHS later (and about 3 tickets) they found out it was a "pre-allocation" configuration in their end and "removed from the filter".Even "emergency" tickets when something is offline, they take between 6 and 12 hours to respond, then say "but is working here"...I started using their services in 2012. This year marks 10 years of use. Since 2017 the company clearly stop caring about the customers and do not prioritize good engineers.Summary: They are incompetent and is YOUR fault!

Review.Titre: Server down over 9 days!  All my sites have been offline.
Review.Contenu: I have shared hosting with them for about 4 months. I have several websites from e-commerce to lead generation sites at the end of July 22 their server went down, it is still not working after 9 days.  All my sites are offline.  Their recovery process is very slow.  Think twice before moving your sites to their shared server environment.

Review.Titre: Seems to be ok until something goes…
Review.Contenu: Seems to be ok until something goes wrongMy site has been down for 2 days now without any meaningful update from them (just that there is a problem with the shared server)Actually letting affected customers know there is a problem and when it will be fixed is a basic. Opened a ticket but no reply to it over 12 hours laterOnly recently moved my site to them and wont be renewing once my first year is up

Review.Titre: My sites are down for more than 96hrs…
Review.Contenu: Some of my sites are down for more than 96hours!, they have a good backend system to monitor their service status which is helpful as support info in a fast way BUT they are too slow to fix their issues. First time I have had this critical issue with Dreamhost and I am very disappointed with their capacity to solve technical issues in their data centers. I sent a support ticket but without any answer yet. MORE THAN 3 DAYS OFFLINE? that is too much for a serious company.

AVOID AVOID AVOID!I migrated to Dreamhost 5 months ago.I am a small business owner, I just upgraded my site which took around 260 hours to do. Now, one week before releasing the site for my customers, this happens. Customer support had nothing another to say, but wait!THIS IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!!
server is slow slow slow. period

Review.Titre: My shared hosting for two separate…
Review.Contenu: My shared hosting for two separate clients accounts have been down for the past week. They have barely provided any information as to what happened and we can't download backups of our websites. They are a joke of a company and the most unprofessional hosting company I have worked with so far.

Been for a long time to appropriately evaluate the service. Mostly got stuck with the service. The worst in customer service, mainly do to quick expansion they lost touch. Second, in my opinion illegal billing practices which makes it almost a scheme. You pay your yearly contract, and then every month you get additional invoices because of some additional service that you neither approved or had no idea, but dreamhost saw it appropriate for you. A total scheme regarding payments.

I bought 1-year package and they immediately suspend my account before my account even registered they even charged the amount. i still haven't got a refund. it's been 5 days. I want to buy another hosting but now I am stuck .. this just sucks !!!

Review.Titre: DreamHost | PHP Email Servers - A Nightmare!
Review.Contenu: I am HORRIFIED at the fact that I just figured out why I haven't been receiving ANY orders over the last couple of months. The PHP email servers on WordPress doesn't work. I submitted orders on each site to test and NONE have been received via email. I never had this issue when I was with GreenGeeks! I have literally lost thousand of dollars worth of orders because of this! When I first moved from GreenGeeks to DreamHost via their migration plugin, I tested all the order forms on each site and they all worked. Since then something went wrong as none of them now work! It is the error of the DreamHost servers side as nothing was modified on my side!

I have had endless issues since migrating over to DreamHost. From downtime to email issues. Now, ALL 4 of my WP sites are down! I am SO frustrated with DreamHost! You GET what you PAY for! Cheap hosting, cheap service!

Useless Customer Care-Pathetic after sales service-Not recommended at all!Their control panel and user dashboard is as useless as their customer care absolute no control over many server settings provided by other hosts.

DreamHost offers horrible Wordpress hosting! PHP emails forms don't work. Haven't received and emails from WP websites within months!Think I will be going BACK to GreenGeeks! Their service is pricier, but AWESOME!

Review.Titre: They are terrible as their shared…
Review.Contenu: They are terrible as their shared hosting don’t use cpanel, configurating sites is difficult,Your sites keep going offline saying that you exceeded php values,,, .I moved all my sites way from them and now I’m good. Only positive thing on them is they have decent support

Review.Titre: Shared servers are down for the last 8…
Review.Contenu: Shared servers are down for the last 8 days and still, they are unable to restore it.Even more, interestingly, they can't promise any resolution to the problem.The worst hosting experience, I have ever experienced.

Review.Titre: Dreamhost is missing lots of feature.
Review.Contenu: Lot's to be disappointed aboutNo (on demand) back and restoreNo plugin managementsNo user options for WordPressNo PHP settings managementsBuggy support chat linkBulky shortcuts everyway you easily get lost in the portalThe auto WordPress login from the portal requires a hidden plugin that doesn't works all the time

Review.Titre: Hell of a year with DreamHost
Review.Contenu: The reason for two stars is the following:- Classic bad promotion- Very slow internet- Blaming- Classic bad promotionI found DreamHost and saw that I need to pay about 50 dollars for the first year, which looked tempting from other reviews, I saw that they were 'praised', but my experience turned into hell.- Very slow internetTheir internet for web hosting is very slow, so much so that sometimes it takes 60-120 seconds to load the website.- BlamingTheir support blames WordPress for being slow and having inappropriate plugins.And if today everything can be easily checked via Ping Check Websites.I tested several types of websites and systems, they also had a very slow internet connection.Even if I brought all this up to Support, he still claimed it was a mistake and stuff like that. What I immediately realized is that it is a 'promotional' sale that is there to attract the customer, then lure him and finally drive him away indirectly.

DECEPTIVE and NON-TRANSPARENT charging. I have been charged $5 every month for the past year and a half for something that was not made properly apparent. I didn't receive any billing information. When I brought this up as an issue I had a glib "corporate speak" response - in essence we took your money and we're keeping it. Feels dishonest and underhand. I've been a customer for over 17years or more... but for the first time I'm now actively looking for alternatives. A business is there to take away problems, not create problems! Dreamhost may have started out well but clearly heading in the wrong direction now.

I have been with Dreamhost since 2007. I host my sites as well as about 30 web design clients. There have always been connectivity issues, but they typically are fixed promptly. My clients don't love it, but it happens. A few months ago, they upgraded my VPS server. Since then, the outages have been frequent. Clients emailing at least once/week saying their sites are down. I report to Dreamhost and they say the sites are up and they need to see it when it's happening. Well, 3 days ago all of my sites went down again. I have been on support chats since then and they say they're going to fix it. In the meantime, I'm fielding calls and emails nonstop from upset clients, and there's nothing I can do. The last time a major meltdown like this happened was a few years back, maybe 2016. At that point I looked into alternatives. Now I'm once again looking at moving my business elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Spammers ruining a good service. Lacklustre support not helping. The fact I have been trying to get…
Review.Contenu: The fact I have been trying to get dreamhost to fix the issues with forwarded emails being blocked due to spammers on their email servers and they refuse to help me after years of trying multiple tricks says I need to use another service who will keep spammers off the servers or change the ip addresses my emails are coming from so they won’t be blocked. I am currently looking to move my websites and email elsewhere since dreamhost doesn’t care about my business.

Review.Titre: Poor user support, aggressive bots removing user content
Review.Contenu: I was DreamHost user for 15 years. I used it to host private projects. Personal blog, family photo gallery, a small website dedicated to my hometown, etc. I observed how the performance seemed to detoriate during the past couple of years. The websites I hosted seem to be loading slower and slower. It was still OK for my purposes though.Then, a few months ago, DreamHost started wiping out content from my home directory. It turned out it was some no longer linked content which I forgot about over the years. This seemed fine to me.More recently though, the wiping-out process started becoming much more aggressive and content that was publicly shared started getting removed on the premise of "misusing the system for backup purposes". The final straw came when they removed all pictures from my family photo album, which I was building and cataloguing over the years using Lychee. I have no clue how they classified it like that. I reached out to support and essentially got informed that it's not allowed to host a (password-protected) web photo gallery anymore on DreamHost... My yearly renewal was in two days. I rushed to download whatever was left and closed the account

As a 9 year customer, we found that out-sourcing of technical support and services at Dreamhost was a big loss for us. We also experienced slow site hosting for the past few years, which made us look else where for our hosting (we reached out for help many times, but was never solved). We ported our site to another host and experienced a speed increase of more than double out of the box. We really liked working with Dreamhost, but became frustrated in the lack of speed and extended support.
a bit slow on the site recovery, and then really nagging for a reviews on thanksgiving...

Dreamhost's shared hosting environment is mismanaged in terms of shared resources.  MULTIPLE times I had to have them move us to a new server instance because bad actors on their system overload their bandwidth.  Their customer service is often worse.  Too many times we were given incorrect information or blatantly gaslighted so their team could avoid seriously investigating real concerns.  Every time this happens, and after hours of wasted time, eventually they realize they're in the wrong and finally fix an issue.All this to be said, we've since moved all of our websites over to SiteGround and don't have any of these issues.
Poor communication through yet another downtime. Little to no comms over a business hours downtime. No post-mortem on the longer than expected downtime.
sometimes when I try to access the website it told me that there is an error cant load this site other times it told me this site is not secure even with ssl certand the costumer service is 5/5

Review.Titre: You can't talk to anyone & have to be an expert
Review.Contenu: While I appreciated the optimization of our site, I found it extremely frustrating that I could not get on the phone to have someone explain to me what was done. Dreamhost will ONLY work with you by email and if you don't ask just the right question, you won't get any helpful information. All I received was before and after reports with metrics that I really didn't understand. When I asked questions by email, in some cases I was told, "Oh that doesn't really matter or mean anything". ??? Additionally, some plugins were duplicated and there was no explanation as to what old plugins should be deleted. Even though I told them I was not strong on technical knowledge and needed further explanations, the approach was that I was an expert web person with full knowledge of insider terminology and best practices.

Review.Titre: Things weren't too bad at first
Review.Contenu: Things weren't too bad at first. But then we hit change Domain Name Servers. Your technical staff sent me up one blind alley after another. They didn't even look at the Whois site. I had to find it for them. Finally, after hour after hour at my computer, almost by accident, I stumbled on a way to do it. I still don't know who the Registrar is. If you find out let me. know.  In sum, this was not DreamHost. It was NightmareHost!

I migrated to their started package with my Wordpress site because it was good value.  Although the frontend loads reasonably fast, it id a nightmare trying to use the backend it is so slow.Then when I try to raise an issue with support I end up in a loop and cannot contact an agent.I certainly would NOT recommend.

Review.Titre: I'm tired of my sites not being available…
Review.Contenu: I'm tired of my sites not being available several times a day. Just right now. And very difficult to chat to someone from the support team. You don't even have a chat form easy to access. The sites don't even have traffic yet, and they are all the time down.ID# 2642376

Everything started out great at first with the basic shared starter plan, but when my site got bigger DreamHost would disable my server when the traffic would spike due to a search engine indexing the site.  They would disable it, and never re-enable it, which is a real problem because once it happened at the start of a vacation and my site was down until I returned.  They offer no help other than trying to push me into a more expensive plan.  I recommend avoiding this host.

The timeline and work took longer was less straightforward than expected. Our site took longer than the 4-6 weeks promised, instead taking 13 weeks and leaving only 4 days to make edits before our live date.Edit requests were not well organized, and our attempts at sending clear lists were often met with only some of the requests completed and no status update for the ones that were not. Ideally, our lists would have been sent back with notes on each item, mentioning what was accomplished and what was not. In addition to the delays, we were not met with what felt like a structured and complete training on Elementor page creation and maintenance.

After normal registration and login, I chose the shared server and paid for 3 years. However, it was later informed that the account has been under review. No support service took the initiative to contact me. Finally, I took the initiative to send the ticket. I was told that my account would not pass the sign up, and it was inconvenient to tell me the reason for the failure. The support service said that the payment will be returned to me. However, after 11 days have passed, there is still no refund.

i paid upfront for annual hosting. i closed account 3 months after renewal & they wont provide a pro rated refund. Plus their customer support is tough to get ahold of. they push you through AI garbage. Find a better customer oriented company.

Review.Titre: All went well FOR YEARS then...
Review.Contenu: All went well FOR YEARS, even if it was somehow expensive. Then I was asked to delete some files that were vital for my website at VERY SHORT NOTICE (10 days). I explained why they were important and asked for ONE MONTH extension, was replied to harshly and my request was rejected. AFTER YEARS OF PAYING $30 a month INTO THEIR PRIVATE SERVER. Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: My main complaint is that while memory…
Review.Contenu: My main complaint is that while memory and space have gotten cheaper over the last 15 years I've been a customer, Dreamhost has chosen to upsell newer more expensive services rather than pass improvements along to older loyal customers like myself. Wordpress sites that used to run fine on shared hosting now consistently run out of memory and return errors. I guess I resent that customers like myself who helped establish DH got shown the front door in the push to become more profitable.

Review.Titre: Problems Signing Up For GSuite...No help!
Review.Contenu: I used chat because I was having trouble signing up for Gsuite. It was suggested that the email I created had been used before to sign up for GSuite and that I why it wasn't letting me sign up. Wrong! I had literally just created that email in order to sign-up for GSuite. The Chat Rep said they would put in a ticket for me. Meanwhile, I went over to Google and signed up for GSuite with that same email..no problem. I then connected it to Dreamhost...no problem. Finally, a week later I get a response to try signing up again. In other words, they were no help whatsoever.

I don't have anything bad to say about you. Excepto for the Email Service, I've been your customer for almost 2 months now, and within this 2 months, I have faced 2 issues each per month, regarding the downtime about Email Service, causing me to delay my operations because I used the email service related to my domain.  This is not good, because it affects the operations of your customers.

So far, I am very disappointed with my experience on DreamHost. The dashboard is very limited in comparison to the cPanel suite of tools I am used to from other hosting sites. More to the point, I am trying to set up a database and find that the version of phpMyAdmin provided is ancient (from 2011) and very clunky. I have encountered multiple errors trying to upload the database and find the process very frustrating.

I received a customer newsletter from Dreamhost that advocated a political view opposed to mine. This was totally unnecessary and soured the whole experience. I hate it when CEOs and owners use companies as their own personal soapbox, when what the company does has nothing to do with their viewpoints. It makes me wonder if I'm supporting the wrong company with my dollars.

I moved a dozen or so WP websites from another popular host and to date I've been disappointed. My VPS server is fine. The database shared server is down quite a bit... at least once or twice a week for a few hours each time. I don't want to purchase a dedicated DB server but it looks like I am going to have to.... or move to a different host.

Support was slow, and the tone of the response from my chase up emails was not friendly and ended in me giving them a 2 star review on TrustPilot, a site I have never used before. So for it to motivate me to come and create a new login at a new site like this, you can see I am not impressed. I pay 20 dollars a month for a wordpress specialist hosting service.

Review.Titre: Ok for basic sites, look elsewhere for mission critical
Review.Contenu: Dreamhost is inexpensive.Customer support is not 24 hours so if your site is mission critical that should be kept in mind.I have had mixed results with customer support. From helpful knowledgeable people to jerks who just gave up without resolving the problem.While support does usually resolve the problem, I run 5 Wordpress sites, 1 on Dreamhost. The one on Dreamhost is the least reliable of the 5.It's cheap, mostly automated but it your site needs high reliability and availability, I would recommend a more robust solution.

I have been with dreamhost for around half a year now and until today had no complaints. I woke up to a call from a client of mine complaining their site was offline. After investigation I found that dreamhost had CHANGED the IP for my VPS out of nowhere. I then got in touch with their support via a live chat, the advisor was trying to be helpful but never gave a me a clear answer as to why the IP had been changed and finally answered with "I can't really tell you why the IP was changed"... not great really. Other than that my experience with dreamhost had been fine.

Review.Titre: Acceptable service to date but THEY SELL YOUR INFORMATION TO SPAMMERS!
Review.Contenu: Service wise we have only used their e-mail service to date and although the interface is very out dated it has been 100% reliable.   My big beef is that dreamhost has sold our signup contact info to spammers and now we are bombarded with junk.  Upon signup i always append signup information so it is unique to each individual service provider.  Not too long after signup we started getting unstoppable spam to our signup email with the exact information used to sign up for Dreamhost.

Review.Titre: I'm in the process of transitioning…
Review.Contenu: I'm in the process of transitioning away from Dreamhost after 11+ years as a subscriber.  Recent limitations on shared-hosting memory limits have taken this to a place where hosting with Wordpress is infeasible and Dreampress isn't economical enough to fit my needs.

QOS : Not good at all, a lot of times page didn't even load, for MySQL- PHP Myadmin is very old version, and a lot of limitations. The number of free applications provided are very limited and not upgraded freuently even if there are upgrades available. With other service providers, I had better experience even with a free demo account. Chose Dreamhost because of a brand name, now I think it was a mistake. Customer Care  response time was Good though. Got response when expected. Didn't have to wait much longer.

Review.Titre: Difficult to Find Products Once You Are a Customer
Review.Contenu: A few months ago I purchased a domain to park and no other products. I wanted to buy another domain using their special they have on now to get a Word Press managed website with a free domain for $6.95 (reg. $9.95). I chatted with a staff member online to find out why the special is gone after I log in. The response I got "oh most specials are reserved for new customers". Are you kidding me? No love for your current customers? I'm going elsewhere from this point forward. It's too bad because I heard good things about DreamHost.

I thought your site would be idiot-proof, apparently I was wrong.  I paid for a domain.  I tried using wordpress, but I click on it and it gives me an error message.  End of experience. Again, I must be a bigger idiot than the programmers predicted would use this site.

At first, dreamhost seems like a good deal.  Low prices, reasonable features, responsive support.  But then if your shared-server web site starts to get just a bit of traffic (and I'm not talking about much, 10 hits/second will do it), it will be disabled without warning.  This happened to me on the first day of my vacation, and the site was down until I returned.  Absolutely unacceptable.  So one overactive client or bot will bring down your whole site.  A better response would be to block the offending IP, but DreamHost doesn't care about you or the people who use your web site.  If you complain to technical support, their only response is to try to push you into a more expensive plan.  The old bait and switch.  The "unlimited" plans are anything but.  Don't fall for this false advertising.

Review.Titre: No support when I needed it
Review.Contenu: Honestly, I'm still a customer out of laziness, not loyalty. When my Wordpress site got hacked, Dreamhost's support left me completely high and dry. I couldn't rightly recommend your services to anyone.
Decisive marketing techniques to attract people with lowest prices and after a year charge them 4 times higher price. Not much impressed with their pricing model. Hosting is good.

this hosting lack of support, to hear them back usually took more than few hours.my site also need more than 3-7seconds before the server answering the request . this usually happened when their server overload (similiar to the case from some of hosting company i tried ).even their webftp sometimes unresponding. also if you are a newbie and not familiar to other than cpanel, i would suggest you to choose another hosting company, since you need to find the way just extract your god damn zip file!! well from the pricing , yes they have a good price indeed , but i dont think i will continue to use their service after my annual plan expired if they are still like this. so lets hope this review can make them get bettet in the future :)
Should have read the fine print better... Who'd have believed Dreamhost would still be running an extremely out-of-date version of MySQL with no option to use anything newer. Very disappointing.

Review.Titre: One SFTP User to Move Files to Domain
Review.Contenu: This is a huge flaw.  While you can create multiple ftp users, the move files into their own account, meaning only one user (root) can access the FTP of the website to upload files, scripts, etc.
Everything has been solid, but the whole $19.95 for a support call is kind of crazy.  I guess it streamlines the service process in some ways, but its frustrating when you need immediate support.

Review.Titre: Good price but weak customer service
Review.Contenu: The price for web hosting is ok but it lacks a proper customer service. The customer service is cutting short and giving you the feeling that you shouldn't ask so much. I am not so happy.

My sites went down for an entire day and it wasn't until I tried to reach the support team that I realized they don't even have a phone number to call.  Edit: They charge you $10 (per call) if you want to talk with someone from support...lol   I opened several tickets and emailed with a live chat person and the support I received was ridiculous.  I had to open several tickets to have my questions answered and their ticket system support process is SO frustrating.  I talked to 4 different people for my problem and each one said something different.   I gave them 2 stars because their UI design is very nice but I can't recommend them because the customer support and hosting issues I've had in the first 30 days of my hosting have been absolutely awful.
Dealing with this company was not a good experience for me at all. Denise was rude, defensive and unprofessional. What a waste of time and money. I ended up redoing all of the work myself.

Very disappointed with their service!I bought a hosting package yesterday from them and was in the process of transferring my hosting over to them, but only to find out that they don't offer phone support unless you pay them. I have 2 more years with my current hosting company and I'm walking away from them because I'm not please with their service so why would I go somewhere else that seem worse? At lease my current provider don't charge me to contact them over the phone! This is a rip off and ridiculous to charge a customer to speak with them over the phone! I am not a savvy tech person so I need help to migrate site, assistance with setting up DNS Records etc... for a savvy person that's not an issue but for me it is. Just email communication is NOT enough and I'm not going to pay them to speak to me over a phone so I will be cancelling my account with them because I don't need this nonsense!

DreamHost came recommended to me by a friend in IT as a fast, reliable hosti provider with great customer service. However my experience hasn't lived up to this recommendation. It took more than 10 back-and-forth emails with customer service to try and resolve a simple hosted email issue. Because the ticket did not stick with the same service agent - and it seemed each subsequent responder didn't review the ticket history - I kept having to repeat the same information, only to get the same inadequate responses back without the additional information / simplified average human speak I kept requesting to resolve. Additionally, my site loads very slowly.... Something further highlighted in a diagnostic I ran on it. My site is very simple and homemade without any significant graphics to justify this slow speed. After my prepaid year is up, I am unsure that I will be continuing with DreamHost.

Review.Titre: Shut down my website unintentionally but then failed to admit it and clean it up.
Review.Contenu: Several weeks ago Dreamhost LOST my data on my website, cleared my entire database overnight, then failed to restore it. My website developer reloaded everything during the time dreamhost continued to give me automated messages that they were looking into it. It wasn't until I tweeted the issue and emailed a VP that dreamhost started responding. Now I have to say the VP was very responsive, courteous and kind and looked into it immediately. By then, however, my site had been restored so dreamhost could not "see" any evidence of an issue.  It was a very frustrating day. I will give them a second chance, but it was very disconcerting to wake up and find the website you spent a lot of time, money and effort on - the one that runs your business, completely gone. Hopefully it was a fluke and won't happen again. I will give them the benefit of the doubt. I just wish customer service was more of a focus.

I just moved here from FatCow because of poor and awfully slow technical  support. Initially, my website was x3 slower than when hosted on FatCow. Now after uninstalled and removing about half of my website functionality and removing all security related plug-ins, my site is only x2 as slow as FatCow (on par with FatCow when using Caching, which I didn't need to use at Fatcow). I continue to get timeouts, HTTP 500 server errors, and very poor performance from the shared hosting. I pre-paid for a year, so after that ends, I will be looking for a better shared hosting provider or possibly returning to FatCow. If you only have a simple Wordpress blog and you're not using any plug-ins and have a low visitor count, then the shared hosting might work fine for you. If you're a small blog (< 1000 pageviews a day) and try to optimize your site with caching, minifying, SEO, etc. then expect to run into memory related problems.

I have been with Dreamhost shared hosting for over a decade, but I am now in the process of migrating my sites over to an EC2 machine on AWS -- I will likely shut down my account with Dreamhost in 2020 before annual renewal.I've really noticed in recent years that the performance of my hosting on Dreamhost has declined, and I was contacted by dreamhost support and asked to stop making backups of my webpages. I built a small script which automatically keeps 3 days of backups, and Dreamhost would not allow me to do it.On AWS I can pay the same amount of money, and have much more flexibility with what I can do on my host. I know Dreamhost provides value add with automatic updates of wordpress and security monitoring, but for me this value add is not enough to compensate for the lack of flexibility and poor hosting performance.My sites which I have migrated over to AWS are performing much much faster.In any case, thanks for what you've done for me over the years.
Dont want to waiste more time...

Review.Titre: Closing account is not for free...
Review.Contenu: Hosting is good, but I need to pay 14$ to close my account. That's not acceptable.

Review.Titre: Years of good service, ended by either new policies or horrible staff
Review.Contenu: I would give DreamHost 4.5+ stars for the years that I was there. and negative stars for the behavior of their support staff that led to me to choose to leave.  I was happily using the service in the exact same way for years.  One day, I was told that I was not allowed to continue to use the service, and that I needed to remove my data.  This was out of the blue, and for no apparent reason.  After some frustrating back and forth discussions, it led to an impass.  I later got an apology from somebody else in the support staff, but by then I had already requested a cancellation and had started service with another provider and had started to move DNS and everything else to the new provider.   Over the years, I had sometimes been told that I'm using too much disk space, or my website is generating too many errors.  Every time, I would work to fix it, and the support staff worked with me while I tried to figure out exactly what they needed me to do.  It wasn't confrontational, until this last one where it sounded like Dreamhost basically decided they didn't want my service.  It was a lot of work and a frustrating situation.  I gave 2 stars because it is probably unfair to give 1 star given years of great service, but the complete and utter lack of quality control on draconian nazi-like support staff is ridiculous.
I asked a simple question, hot a real general response and now no replies for 4 days

Review.Titre: This website took six months to build
Review.Contenu: This website took six months to build - whereas I was led to believe (by the sales team) that it would take a month. It is not a commercial site or one that sells products. The average length of time it took for each minor change was 3-5 days or so - and there were many. Sometimes the version that I was asked to review included changes I did not ask for - which resulted in more changes. I think it would have helped immensely if we had been able to discuss the pages being built through a screen share session instead of  me being asked to review each page as it was finished and provide feedback. The feedback I gave seemed to be either misunderstood or ignored.  This resulted in me sending back sometimes several written pages with screen shots to try to explain what needed to change. Often the next version I got back to review - only addressed some of the feedback I gave but not all of it. As you can imagine this was very time consuming and frustrating. There did not seem to be any project quality control - as I was sent pages to review that had - for example - a banner photo with a splice line very visible running through the middle of it. Also the team's selection of elements like social media icons were all over the board - no consistency in size or style. I didn't think these types of things should have to be pointed out by the customer during the feedback stage, and each one of these items - seemed to take an additional 3-5 days to be addressed. The project lead was a very nice person -  but I'm not sure what his role was on the build project - other than liaison with customer - so not sure if he had any say or influence with the actual web team/ coders. I have never given anyone a two star rating before - but I am doing so in this case because the description of services on your website fell quite short of my actual experience.

Review.Titre: Customer Service Has Deteriorated Over the Years
Review.Contenu: I wish I had the same results as these other reviewers. I have been with DreamHost since 2004 and stayed with them for their customer service, but the quality has completely deteriorated to the point I'm moving everything to another provider.I realize as a shared hosting customer, I'm probably not very high priority--but it doesn't really feel good when I wanted to use Dreamhost for my ecommerce business and don't feel I would get the quality of service I need at scale. A customer should not have to complain on Twitter to get escalated to a support lead. I had a couple of very minor issues that took over 2 weeks to fix because the agents never actually read the emails I sent, just responded with a template that had a vaguely similar keyword. The last straw was when after waiting for days for a fix, I asked GSuite for help. They actually went through proper triage steps and fixed the issue in 5 minutes.When I gave the rep feedback about this, he and said he had never seen the records that needed fixing when I had referenced it in my first email which meant the tickets are definitely not getting the attention they need. If you have a relatively easy problem that can be fixed through reading the Customer Help wiki, then their Customer Service is fine. If you have any issue that needs a human look into your case, enjoy waiting for 1-2 days for a response that's essentially the same thing you just read online until you get so frustrated you end up screaming on the internet. If you're a business owner, you have better things to do than hold a customer service rep's hand while you triage the problem for them. After 16 years, I will be taking my business elsewhere. I checked my customer support records and the last time I asked for help was 6 years ago. I'm not a whiner, just disappointed.

Review.Titre: Bad customer service and incomplete control panel
was never a fan of your platform
Customer Service Lectured Instead of Helping
Review.Contenu: The customer service team has lectured me and charged me for service I didn't want, and didn't need.  I couldn't understand the connection between hosting and email, and was overpaying for email service monthly for many years.  The customer service support team corresponded with me, a now very angry customer over the day.  I've been billed for hosting fees when all I wanted was email.  The customer service team lectured me instead of helping.  I've been with Dreamhost for more than ten years.  I was prepared to continue email service for the next year but they saw fit to bill me for hosting fees. I'm very let down by the bad faith and legalistic customer service style.  In particular, I am disappointed by Jonathon, Gus and Truman in billing who took the time to say things like:  "When I reviewed your account's support history, I confirmed that you did not contact us about ending your shared hosting service until earlier today"  That was from Truman.Translation:  I tried my damndest to resolve my billing problem on my own and not bother anybody about it, but couldn't understand how hosting and email works.  So I'm supposed to contact customer service every time I have a problem, or else I won't get any kind of refund?  I have received much fairer customer service from many other companies I've worked with for just as long as Dreamhost.Truman condescends further:"I prorated your shared hosting charge posted on  for the time hosting services were rendered to you as a courtesy"  Well gee, thank you so much, Truman. but if you were really trying to help, you'd recognise that I've been overcharged for years for hosting fees that weren't necessary and not what I wanted.  Again:  "You need to manually go through the process of canceling the service from your panel, which was not done correctly."  That was GusP."The active Shared Hosting plan was indeed hosting your active Mailboxesduring that time,  and Indeed hosting service is required for your Email hosting. Had you properly canceled the service at that timeyour email service would have ended as well. However since the service was not canceled your Email service was still active and your mail continued to function during that time."Well Gus, isn't it obvious that I tried to do it, but I'm obviously not techy.  But at least I'm an honest, long-term customer.  So what, now I just get charged even more for service I didn't want and didn't need.  Because I "didn't manually do things correctly".I've been writing to Dreamhost for hours today.  I've been helped by many other companies I've had to stop working with because money is tight, but Dreamhost has been the most difficult and unhelpful by far.

I wanted to start off by saying that if you're looking for inexpensive shared hosting, this is probably a decent choice. Just hope you don't have to place any requests or speak to their 'team' at any point in time.  I really hate to leave a negative review, but I feel my experience was fairly unacceptable and thought people should know. It all started when I was curious about signing up for an additional package on top of my shared hosting package for a project I was working on. I had signed up for their shared hosting plan before they offered them on SSD's, but now all new customers are apparently offered this and they specifically offer an option in your "Manage Account" section to request migration to SSD hosting so I thought I'd give this a shot and see if there was any performance difference before signing up a second package. I did this towards the end of May. Once you process this automated request they send you an automated response and tell you that you're on the waiting list and ask that you remove an unused files etc to quicken the process. Not a problem. A week and a half go by and I haven't heard anything about the process so I thought I'd jump into their live chat to ask about how long it will take. I spoke to a rep who states "It appears there wasn't an explicit request to get moved to the new ssd hosting", even though its an automated system through their own control panel that even sends a confirmation that you can plainly see in my support history. I explain this to him and he's nice and says "Ok currently the admin that is doing the migrations is not working so I can't get a definite answer for you right now. But, I will submit a ticket for you and escalate so I can get an answer for you". Fair enough, thanks. A little less than a week go by, no response. I go back into chat and ask for an update and am told "Okay, it looks like there was some miscommunication before, sorry. You can submit a new ticket about this here to specifically request being upgraded to SSD hosting" ????? ok, now I'm a bit frustrated. I explain that I've already sent in a request, and spoke to someone who was suppose to escalate my ticket. He then responds "Okay, I've submitted an expedite request for this for you now. We'll get you upgraded as soon as we possibly can". Great, thank you for your help. The next day I get a response from their "SSD Migration Team" saying thanks for being patient, they've logged my request and that they may not be able to have it migrated for "a week or two". Keep in mind this is on 6.12.2015 after a few contacts already. Two and a half weeks go by, and I thought I'd just check up on the status, they essentially tell me there has been no update on the progress and that I'll be alerted when it's been taken care of. At this point I've decided to go with another provider for my additional services, but decide to keep my shared hosting account and request for SSD migration. Their rep says he understands, and that they will let me know again when this will take place. Almost 3 weeks since then and still no update. This is probably the worst experience I've ever had with a hosting company. Two months for a small migration request on an account that doesn't use much space to begin with, and a bunch of contacts with absolutely no resolution. I kept the rating at 3 stars because I feel like I really shouldn't expect much from my shared hosting account. Overall I'm very dissatisfied, and unfortunately they lost potential revenue from the additional VPS accounts/other hosting solutions I was planning to open with them that I've went elsewhere for. Hoping to get some resolution at some point for this though. But I won't hold my breath at this point. Edit* Lowered to two stars after laughable trustpilot response. Did you even read a thing I said? It's been two months and absolutely no progress has been made aside from claiming I am in queue that lasts 1-2 weeks when it's been 8. Everytime I reach out its more and more infuriating. I've reached out to you through your automated system, through your ticket system, through your chat system, and through trustpilot. Now you wish me to reach you via twitter? No thanks.
I requested partiner dreamhost istill my account is pending at least 5 days agoSo i wish to activate my account in this week thanks for aproving me

Review.Titre: The support ticket system is bad
Review.Contenu: The support ticket system is bad, cannot continue in the same ticket thread for support. The webmail is also bad. I wish there was an IOS app for the webmail.
Support was responsive, but not exceedingly helpful. Still felt like I was on my own to really figure anything out or determine the best route for an efficient solution.

Tech support is really great, always has been.  What I am annoyed with is that the staging for a hot spare of the hardware was not there.  3 hours of downtime for all my sites is just not acceptable and unreasonable.  This has given me pause and shaken my previous total confidence in DH ability to ensure uptime.  Someone needs to step in and determine what it will take to ensure better uptime.

Review.Titre: Nice people but no transparency in their operations…
Review.Contenu: I appreciate that the customer service rep I spoke with was able to fix the issue I was having, which was that my MYSQL connection broke and my website was down. When I asked for details about why the connection broke, or what the tech did to fix the issue I received the stock response of "someone higher up than me fixed it" and no additional information. This continued lack of transparency about what is happening on my web server and why it seems to happen "randomly" and the fact I am unable to deal with these issues on my own is pushing me away from Dreamhost. I repeatedly indicate that I am familiar with technology and I communicate with the customer service reps in terms that should convey to them that I am familiar with how servers work, but the the stock answer of "don't worry about it, we'll just fix it for you" is getting old and worn out and it erodes my trust in the company and their product. My websites shouldn't just lose a connection to the database server for no reason or randomly and when it does, I want to know why. I want to know how we can prevent it in the future to protect my customers' best interests. Again, the tech was helpful and courteous, but the lack of information is driving my business away from this company.

Review.Titre: Monika gets 5 stars for getting the…
Review.Contenu: Monika gets 5 stars for getting the site right and making whatever changes and adjustments I needed. Although the rest of the team was responsive, it was too often someone different everytime I had issues getting the site switched over from Web.com. The same contact would have been more helpful. The transition required much more input from me that I hadn't expected, and wasn't very confident in my abilities. I thought from my initial conversations that Dreamhost would be in charge of the change over details. Probably a misunderstanding from the outset when I signed up. Now that we're up and running your site is easy for me to navigate and the more current version of Wordpress is easier for me to make price changes. I would absolutely recommend Dreamhost to someone, but I'd make sure they'd know they'd have a role to play in the transition.

Review.Titre: Easy to use, but not truly "unlimited"
Review.Contenu: Websites are up and running very quickly, but UNLIMITED is not true in terms of storage. When I reached and close to 1TB my files were transferred to their Cloud Storage option with no notice. Had to negotiate and move the majority of my files to a cheaper, external S3 service. I had download all files and re-upload my website to reinstate it. Time consuming, considering it's a hobby! Expensive, too. Had to pay upfront due to automated payment systems, and then be reimbursed afterwards.If on their Shared Server and your website causes "server load" issues (either due to crawlers and bots, which can't be blocked until they start causing a problem, or due to a temporary surge in popularity), they will simply disable your site until it is under control. In most cases reactivating it is easy enough, but it depends on the support person and their experience.

Review.Titre: It’s the target of hacking a lot
Review.Contenu: It’s the target of hacking a lot. They push Wordpress like there’s nothing else on the internet, even though it’s always Wordpress that gets repeatedly hacked and wiped.
