The customer service is a crapshoot, either very willing to be helpful or immediately brushing you off. The pricing is also outrageous for some of the services it offers.

Review.Titre: I had to figure out SMTP by myself.
Review.Contenu: We had agreed the site would be live Sunday afternoon in my time zone. It wasn't ready until Monday morning. One other problem, but it would have been a deal-breaker for someone without my experience: I had to figure out SMTP by myself. There was no other hope for password resets or adding other users.

Review.Titre: Great service. Horrible account closing experience.
Review.Contenu: While I was using the service my experience was great and support was helpful most of the times. When I no longer needed the service the issues started appearing. The account closing procedure was horrible. After an extensive back and forth with support after 2 months of struggling my account got closed successfully. I really appreciate that in the end my issue got resolved. I would return easily if I ever want basic website hosting again at a good monthly price.

Dreamhost always has good service. I run a VPS on DreamCompute with them and I'm always aware that they may at any time say "well it's a VPS and you're on your own", but they do strive to provide help and pointers and they are pretty responsive.
Honestly I am not happy with the service. too many unscheduled outages. and when it is scheduled maintenance and IPs are changed it is also a problem.We are thinking of changing provider.

Review.Titre: They did what they said they would do
Review.Contenu: They did what they said they would do - remove malware. Only 3 stars because they invoice sent originally was for the wrong amount and took them some time to correct, delaying the repair. And in general they were slow to respond.

Review.Titre: Most of the time it works
Review.Contenu: Most of the time it works, but we were offline for more than 1 hour last week and we had no technical explanation of the cause of the problem and no compensation for losses.

I think the platform is alright, but not the best fit for me and my company needs. I don't like that we must pay to get on the phone with someone for customer service. There is a free live chat but its recently been too full to get a real person, so I had to recently undergo requesting a call and I must say Luis G was amazing. He made the call well worth my money (price is $9.95 for one call) and exceeded my expectations to help me resolve my issue. He even proceeded to email me resources to continue helping me. I truly appreciate and value great customer service and I received that. Thanks.

Overall, the services are okay, but there are a few aspects that are not very satisfactory. Occasionally, there are performance issues that can have a negative impact on the website's operation. Additionally, some features of the control panel could be more intuitive, and at times, it's necessary to search for the tools needed.

A good decent hosting that tries to keep up with the others. Fair pricing as well. However, their technology seems a bit dated with only dedicated support for Wordpress. Changing PHP version is not a quick switch like other Hosts I've used. Instead, it takes around 10 mins tops for the changes to take effects, same with changing back. The support system is very dated and limited. On each ticket you raise, they reply in a completely new Post, not quoting your original one which makes it hard to track. Their email system as well works in a weird manner. If you set an auto-forwarder, it does not actually save a copy of the email but rather forward the email to the new destination, so you have no copy. All in all, it's a decent host which I would recommend to people with basic projects but if you need advance tools and support, this is not it.

Need more to improve!Guys, you need to improve the performance in installations with Wordpress in the Sharing Web Hosting, also more RAM is needed in the Internet sites, oh and another thing please do not eliminate the part of the domains section, for me it is very important .

Review.Titre: We seem to be having our emails bounce…
Review.Contenu: We seem to be having our emails bounce and have contacted dream host about it and they insist it is not their fault.  It is impossible to get them on the phone.  I would go to another company that is more helpful, if I knew of one.

Review.Titre: The specialist support is very fast and…
Review.Contenu: The specialist support is very fast and efficient! Customer service is always available to assist you.Highly recommend them.Edit: Amended to 3 stars, I upgraded to their Dreampress dea, during upgrade the agent ASSURED me that my old plan would cancel and my new 'Dreampress' plan would be the only thing I'd be billed for. This was not the case for 4 months and I was billed for my old and new services. When I contacted their billing department I was met with a man named Trueman, who was cobative and had a SEVERE lack of customer service experience. (I am being nice here as the majority of customer support there are really good but it takes one sour apple.)Trueman informed me that it was my fault entirely! And clearly stated I will not get a refund for this. (Still have not received my refund.)  Now the best bit, he informed me that I am now leaving dreampress, so I am. This was an appalling experience, I was not expecting this at all, especially after all of my prior experiences with dreampress customer support being honest and in good faith. However this one person could not even apologize for it not being clarified by the initial agent when I made the upgrade.

The response time from technical support would be a 5 star. The actual DreamHost Remixer templates are extreamly basic and not able to customize the differet templates. Finding out it may not fit my nonprofit business.

Review.Titre: I've been with them since 2006 and…
Review.Contenu: I've been with them since 2006 and they've been really solid until this past year. I've had 2 major outages where my VPS was down for 12+ hours.

Review.Titre: A good job moving a large website, but not without issues…
Review.Contenu: The Professional Services team at DreamHost did something that we couldn’t accomplish on our own; move a large WordPress-based website from another hosting service. We had tried to do this ourselves, but the site was too complex to move. The team had the site moved very quickly, but then we began to have issues. Basically, the site was so large and complex that the shared server we had moved to was being overwhelmed. Eventually we moved it to a virtual private server and all is now well. The reason I’m not giving a five-star review is that the migration team should have done more to ensure that we were moving to a properly-configured server. If that work had been done, we could have avoided the downtime and significant revenue loss that we experienced.This should be part of every migration prior to starting. If there was a way for the team to determine the resources being used on an existing WordPress installation, compare that with the destination server, and ensure that the migrated site is going to run efficiently on the new server, it would go a long way toward resolving issues during large site migrations.
Good when it works, which is most of the time, slow support when there is a problem.

Review.Titre: The migration process from my current…
Review.Contenu: The migration process from my current site to DreamPress was quick; however, I was under the impression that the migration process would take my site content and create a WordPress site through DreamPlus Plan.

The team was professional and completed the migration in a reasonable timeframe. There was some confusion when I kept getting contacted by different people on the team, and one email referred to a hacked website fix (which was meant for someone else). I haven't yet received the refund for the $99 that I was told would be returned since I didn't really need the email migration service.

Review.Titre: Our website started timing out too…
Review.Contenu: Our website started timing out too early out of the blue - far less than specified in the php.ini file. I created a trouble ticket. What they told me to do didn't help. But the problem is fixed now. I'm guessing someone restored a setting.The worst part is the condescending attitude of a support person who has no idea what the problem is.

The migration went relatively smoothly. Only issue is lack of instruction for what I needed to do on my end ("Point DNS to DreamHost" without telling me how). And not being able to help on the weekend meant our site had to be down two days longer than necessary.

Review.Titre: Neither cheap nor fast..just mediocre. (Wordpress Shared)
Review.Contenu: I have been with Dreamhost since 2019 but decided to switch providers when my one year contract was up this year. Back then I was attracted by their comparably low prices for basic Wordpress and their much better privacy policy compared to some other companies. But I was never really happy. Dreamhost was always slow...building a website, uploading and managing images took so much time. Their panel while it works fine is not very user friendly.There were some other things like I was checking upgrade possibilities and wham I sign up for a new contract without actually authorizing a payment or seeing a final confirmation screen. The support eventually cancelled my mistaken order.When I canceled my plan this year neither did I receive a refund for the last remaining month nor was I able to actually keep my website running until my contract ended. They would with one click just end my hosting even though I paid for a full year. I expected them to keep my plan running until my contract runs out. I already transferred my website so I probably wont bother complaining about it to them but I found this to be rather customer unfriendly.The last year I had several outages when my website was not available. Sometimes I did not even find any information on their website or Twitter. Downtimes seemed to have increased in 2022.In the end Dreamhost Shared Wordpress is just very slow and not worth the money. The are cheaper and faster options out there.

Review.Titre: My site has gone down twice in a week
Review.Contenu: My site has gone down twice in a week. It came back quickly but I am worried about this happening more often. Also, it is not very intuitive to report the issue. I had to search pretty hard for something on the panel and didn't know if I had found the right thing. How about an option "My Site is Down?"

I could highly recommend DreamHost until now, but for the past 3 days my website is now unreachable or very difficult to reach due to connection problems to the shared hosting server.Although DreamHost has a status page that receives regular updates stating that the problems have been detected and should be fixed soon, unfortunately the fix is still ongoing. There is simply a lack of technical capacity.I would like to recommend DreamHost 100%, but since I have not experienced such a large server outage with any other hoster, I can only do so conditionally.

Review.Titre: I've been a customer for a little over…
Review.Contenu: I've been a customer for a little over a week. I migrated my wordpress. I like do the speed of my page. However, my email is a mess. I had requested assistance with transferring my old emails into dreamhost and it has been quite difficult. i kept getting transferred to someone else in the chat and waited a very long time. I will keep an open mind since i have 97 days to be satisfied. But, thus far I'm not sure if i will stay with them....

The team did what I asked but it was such a struggle to get it done and took far longer than necessary for a simple fix. There's no way to speak to a human and having to do everything through email slowed the process down. I know better customer service will be much appreciated by your subscribers.

Review.Titre: Staff was friendly but due to location…
Review.Contenu: Staff was friendly but due to location was difficult to make edits or communicate as efficiently as I would have liked.   I believe language barrier was a bit of a problem when trying to relay what I desired.  They were persistent in their efforts to provide my desired outcome which I appreciated.  However, took too long!

Review.Titre: I had an issue with my website
Review.Contenu: I had an issue with my website, and the information the support team provided was not relevant to my concern; moreover, I can say very unprofessional staff. However, I also have hosting from hostitbro; they are providing very good services, and prices are also low.

Review.Titre: Sales answered an email, then asked me to write a review.
Review.Contenu: I asked Sales a question via email. They answered via email. I have no idea if the service is good, or if they respond this quickly after they have your money. They asked me to write a review based on that one Sales email. The Internet is a silly place.

Review.Titre: DMJ is well known for trading in…
Review.Contenu: DMJ is well known for trading in Silver, Gold, Bras, GS and Other fashionable/ traditional jewelries among the sellers and buyers. Its main focus is to provide a platform, with direct trading power. DMJ as a platform is a direct channel to the traders to sell and buy their Jewelry, Precious and Semi Precious Stones including other luxury items overseas. Sellers are getting Seller Account, Video and Photo Shoots, Photo Editing, Pick up and Delivery, Relationship Management Team including Sales and Marketing executives and 24/7 customer care support for no price.

Review.Titre: Not the best, not the worst.
Review.Contenu: Have used them for a number of years in addition to numerous other hosts. Their regular shared hosting is slow and the support is very very slow. It can take days or even a week or so before I get a response. I run Wordpress sites on a variety of hosts and the performance here is lackluster. One would hope you don't have to buy the more expensive Wordpress hosting just to get decent performance.At least they finally incorporated free SSL with Let's Encrypt.

Review.Titre: Great service, Inadequate live support opening times
Review.Contenu: Great service but Poor availability of live customer service.They have a great service, good downtime, good pricing and very helpful live customer service...when you finally reach them.The issue is their live customer service isn't available 24/7 (they are only open 5:30AM - 9:30PM Pacific Time) and their email support response times are atrocious (about 24hrs or more).This especially becomes a problem when your site is down when their live support isn't available

Dreamhost 'lost' my entire inbox once. Imagine it. It was devastating. They offered unlimited storage, but told me I had too much mail (after ten+ years, about a gig). They told me due to the timing of their backups, it would be impossible to restore my mail. Despite such shady behavior, and a truly terrible webmail interface, they're probably as good or better than other hosts. I've been with them many years, and have mostly had informed, helpful service.

Everything was excellent except for one major problem. I was not adequately informed that there would be downtime for my website or when it would occur. I had scheduled a very important website feedback session and it unfortunately happened during my website downtime. There would have been no problem if the Dreamhost staffer said "your website will go down when we do this next step for as much as 48 hours" - I could have scheduled accordingly on my end. Staff did not respond for over 12 hours and I was very anxious that the website was down and I didn't understand why.I highly recommend that your staff that they let clients know ahead of time when the downtime will occur.Otherwise, everything was excellent!

I'm using wordpress to create my website. But sometime Dreamhost very slow to access into my website although I think my site doesn't seem too heavy. Even I access into the admin area it's also very slow. Actually, only the first month of using, Dreamhost worked with normal speed and the next two months of my using, it's often very slow. I hope you will resolve this issue soon.

As a new member, I am not yet wow by the service since everything is online and the element of confusion &/or lack of clarity on how to set up various functions is currently high.  Although online, the response time is amazing and they are accurate on issue resolution.  This relationship is growing for the better and I hope to update in near future to a 5 Star service.

It was easy to set up our site, but transferring our old domain name has been a bit trickier.  I have been charged for the transfer even though it didn't go through.  When I contacted a DH customer service rep all they could tell me was my outstanding balance!  They did not even try to understand my question or resolve my issue..... I would love to get this resolved.....

Review.Titre: No domain management, poor user interface
Review.Contenu: I have registered a domain, but I wasn't able to set my own nameservers, so I ended up transferring the domain. The administration interface is not very clear, it reminds me of the 90s. Update: There is in fact a form to set nameservers for my other domain and it's easy to find. I suspect there was a bug with my other domain, possibly related to .software tld.

Just get a new account with this company to check.Service is good, server work fine. Else Control panel is very not user friendly and very poor, a lot of basic function are not as a simple file manager. So if you are not cusual with FTP, Filezilla, Putty and SSH it is maybe not the right choice. Prefer some offer with Cpanel or PleskWhy don't developp some Webmin to handle server. But else for the price it is doing the job. Gilles L.

Review.Titre: Their email program is terrible but support is pretty good
Review.Contenu: I haven't been with Dreamhost long - my primary impression so far is that the program they use for webmail is terrible. Having your account imported into gmail is pretty difficult for someone not super tech-savvy, so I wish they used something better than Squirrel Mail, which looks like a relic from 1998.  Their tech support is pretty okay, though.

Review.Titre: I cannot rate this job until it is…
Review.Contenu: I cannot rate this job until it is really completed (I need funds to pay the time to fix the broken images and complete the migration of some missing posts).

The website looks good, with interesting products.But after signing up I see that there is no cpanel, and that the backend doesnt show any relevant changes over the last yrs. the chat support function is also a bit oldfashioned.For non techies its difficult to grasp the features and advantages of the cloud products

Review.Titre: Love the values, struggle with support
Review.Contenu: I love that DreamHost is committed to green and is employee owned. These values are very important to me and is the reason I keep coming back. However, the customer support is not as good as BlueHost/Hostmonster or Hostgator. When I'm able to reach someone, the interchanges are often (not always) not "warm" and nearly always point me to the wikipedia for me to resolve my own issues. The problem with your wiki is that it's so far over my head that I feel helpless and stranded.

Review.Titre: IMAP email & Junk Filtering could use improvement
Review.Contenu: We came over to Dreamiest from Hostway.  We had a pretty seamless IMAP experience previously, but with Dreamiest we are still having to manually update multiple devices with previously read email continuing to show as unread.  Also, the UI for Junk filtering is rather heard to navigate and manage.

Review.Titre: Price is great but speed is a problem
Review.Contenu: Price is great, but speed is a problem every year. We aren't a high traffic site by any means, and we run a pretty ordinary WordPress site without even any commerce, and it is just. So. Slow.  Cache services basically fix it, but it is disappointing.

When I compare with other two hosting companies I see dreamhost is good in terms of storage and bandwidth. Also performance is best in all hosting. But I have experienced issues with managing files, archives via web interface, application handling tasks like cloning, backing up.

Review.Titre: I love this but the guy named Heather make me disappointed
Review.Contenu: If you request a live chat, beware of the guy called Heather. I don't know if this is a real name but the way he supported his customer was unacceptable. Whenever asking a question, he just told me to Google before asked, what the heck is this kind of customer service?

Review.Titre: Was only with them for a week!
Review.Contenu: DreamHost does not provide website Migration, something any decent Hosting Provider offers for free. That was the only reason I canceled my service a week after signing up. I really should have looked at that before signing up but oh well, you live and you learn!

The customer service has been helpful and the controls given to me to manage my site are very thorough, but not very user friendly.  My main concern is that the package I purchased advertised itself as great for Wordpress websites.  However, each page loads so slowly, it's very unprofessional to my users.  I hardly have any content on my site yet it loads each page far too slowly.  I hate to think how slow it will become when I have had this site for a year or two to build up content.  I fail to see how any Wordpress installation could be considered "great" at this speed.

Review.Titre: Very professional, but slow answering on Tickets
Review.Contenu: They are able so solve any problem in a very professional way, BUT the time of the answers to the tickets is far away from what a customer need (especially for those who are living in EU where we have to wait 12/24 hours for an answer).

To understand the frustrations you would have to review the support cases. Your servers are setup well. The operation seems flawless. The flaw is both people and robots just want the quote a wiki and close a case. No one seems to care if it works.

Tech support takes too long. Not enough people to help you. Didn't have the type of web page I was looking for. After several days of frustration I went with a different company to host my web page. I only have my domain with Dream host now.

After 2 months I have more 'offline' problems then before with my email > smtp. Never expected that and I'm very disappointed about that. Other things like support is perfect, same with fast connection + server time.

Long-time DreamHost customer, reached out for assistance with a domain name problem months ago and was given the runaround. Wound up losing the domain to a Chinese bulk squatter. Thanks a lot, DreamHost.

Review.Titre: Very good but email a concern
Review.Contenu: Switched to DreamHost from GoDaddy because I had read good reviews on DreamHost and GoDaddy was always an upsell. Had to dig a bit a to get things setup but finally got everything seemingly working well. However, email continues to be a concern for a couple reasons. One, there seems to be a front end and back end engine with changes not always sticking. Two, and this is the big complaint, Anti-SPAM controls are significantly lacking. Blacklist / Whitelist doesn't seem to work at all. I have almost all of my mail sent to Junk whereas my wife has almost all her junk mail sent to her Inbox. We both have the same settings. Not sure what is going on with that but DreamHost should address it.

Review.Titre: Good services, but could be more beginner friendly.
Review.Contenu: It would be beneficial to have tutorials of how to upload files to the sever for people who have never done it before. A customer service number would also be nice so we can talk to people when there is confusion.

Review.Titre: Dreamhost has been stuck at the same…
Review.Contenu: Dreamhost has been stuck at the same service offering for a long time, eg: PHP hosting. They could have diversified the service a little, trying to be more of a platform like Heroku and DigitalOcean.

Review.Titre: Good till you have an issue
Review.Contenu: I ran into a problem with my website which had never happened with the previous provider. It is a small, low-traffic, simple WordPress site, yet with Dreamhost I got few 500 errors, and all I heard from the support was: "your site takes too much memory, try to remove plug-ins, index your database, read our wiki articles, etc." but nothing specific, nothing really helpful. So the problem has gone somehow by itself, and still have no idea what really happened.Dreamhost does not use C-panel, instead there is an uncomfortable menu with hidden functions and weird arrangement. For example, what they call "dashboard" is actually a set hyperlinks to their hosting news. I don't know why they do that.

Review.Titre: Good hosting, slow at times, backend takes time to get used to.
Review.Contenu: Good value for money so far, too bad its a bit slow in terms of speed and updating/adding stuff on the backend.  Support is paid extra, and the wiki some tooics are outdated... But i guess its worth to try

Review.Titre: Dreamhost used to be very very good web…
Review.Contenu: Dreamhost used to be very very good web hosting service, but unfortunately on the last couple of years it is going slowly down the grade. It is still good, but not brilliant as it used to be.
Having set up a new account to make sure I was sharing a hosting account with my original designer I am having real problems transferring a database. Can't seem to find anyone able to do it.

The amount of available services for the money is excellent.  Economically, it was a very good choice. By typical support, I mean the fact that I was hoping DreamHost would provide better and more expanded technical support than other hosting services.  I was hoping that I would be hiring a technical support staff that would work with me and my customized needs, but mostly I receive a "we won't talk about that" or "we don't support custom configurations".  While that is indicative of the industry, I was hoping for more with DreamHost.  I'm not an *nix Admin, but I am forced to become one, because of a couple of custom configurations that I must have. Bottom line: good prices and good services, average technical support.

Review.Titre: Haven't been a customer for years
Review.Contenu: it's interesting that you would send me this survey years after I left your service because it was slow and you were unresponsive so here's your review. Not great.
The service dreamhost provide is good. Just the host plans are a little pricey or do not offer trial plans to really test out the service without spending an arm and a leg.

Review.Titre: Very Good but the mail server is crliminal
Review.Contenu: Very Good hosting, maybe the best in the world. But the mail server is a very bad, and some partner don't received my mail because your mail server on 2 blacklist.
Dreamhost says, "Welcome to the Dream Host family!"  Great, so you're my Mommy and Daddy, now.  But I still can't call you on the phone!

Review.Titre: Decent options for the price, but some issues crossing over
Review.Contenu: When moving my domain over from the previous servers with my new account, I thought I wasn't going to be charged since I was using my "Free domain name" to be used for this purpose. Instead I found myself paying a fee to transfer it to DreamHost's servers. I have not had the time to call them about it. Additoonally, their mail client is HORRIBLY old and next to useless, many users that use the site I host still use the "built in" web client to access their e-mail and find using this new system confusing, odd and old.  There is also HEAVY amounts of spam that gets through as compared to other hosts even with the "spam filter" on. All in all it isn't bad for the price, especially comparing the e-mailing features as far as the amount of people can used compared to other big companies, however the client for all the possible usage needs some SERIOUS work.

Review.Titre: I cannot figure out the next step
Review.Contenu: I truly don't understand why i cant get past the first couple steps of creating my page. it seems to be stuck in limbo, with no further instructions

Review.Titre: Dreamhost has been a great webhost
Review.Contenu: Dreamhost has been a great webhost, I'm ready for more services for my money (VPN, cloud storage) as storage costs have dropped over time.
I like dream host and what they provide for our non-profit.  I guess the only issue is that they don't seem to have phone support on demand.
Bad, slow support. Takes multiple tries to contact them before they ever accept you have an issue and stop giving copy-paste answers.

Review.Titre: Not as much freedom as I expected
Review.Contenu: Don't attempt to use a php framework.  A lot of the builtin functionality of Laravel, for instance, does not work.
I wish you used a standard cPanel. There's definitely a learning curve for your somewhat non-intuitive back end.
Even though my site is just for development and things are fairly well optimized, the server tends to be quite slow.

Review.Titre: Tricky pricing scheme and subpar support service.
Review.Contenu: Signed up for a Dreamhost shared hosting account with a "free domain." I did not know how long the free domain lasted ... for one year or for the lifetime of the account, etc.? When I contacted support, they did not directly answer the question and only stated that as long as I am "an active customer," I will have a free domain. Obviously, this introduced a whole new level of complexity. What if I do not make a payment for a billing cycle? Also, I believed that my website would be hosted in the Los Angeles data center, as I live less than 30 miles from LA and I was guessing that the Dreamhost signup flow would detect where I was, based at least on my IP address. Wrong! My site ended up being hosted on the other side of the country, in Virignia! Contacted support, and yet again, I was given an indirect answer. I canceled my account within their ~90 day money back time-window. Got my money back for the hosting plan, but I did not get my money back for my domain ... in other words, a partial refund. Would definitely think twice before dealing with Dreamhost in the future.

Review.Titre: Great support, not so sure about the answer.
Review.Contenu: Great support, got answers fast. But not very helpful. Still not sure about my answer.

Review.Titre: Good value and fairly reliable, but more teething issues than expected
Review.Contenu: I turned to Dreamhost because I needed to host a Canadian domain alongside British and some global .com. Not all hosts support all of these particularly ones in Europe and UK. Dreamhost does.There are loads of hosts that I could have gone to. Dreamhost was amongst a few with a good reputation. Their pricing was also good and about the only one that had fair pricing over a number of years. Not unsustainably cheap for first 12 months followed by the trauma of a price hike month 13 and the inconvenience of shifting everything away.So I was pleased to sign up with DH and figured this could be a longer term relationship. However there are a few issues which have caused inconvenience.Firstly I assumed that DH would offer all of what other hosts offer and more. One such feature would be multiple FTP accounts. This way I can offer a log in to a content producer which allows them limited access to parts of a website. I was amazed to understand I'm limited to one account per domain which means I'd have to share access to an entire website, or temporarily limit it and then share my password with someone else. Really can't believe it.It doesn't end there. Whilst trying to set up FTP access via Dreamweaver I kept entering details and was told password incorrect or FTP problem. Kept trying. Found it locked ALL my accounts from FTP access not just new one. Figured it was a system level problem Eventually contacted support, which is at least good. Seemed I'd been locked out for some reason, Not explained.I also find the whole dashboard really overwhelming. There are definitely serious usability issues which keep users on their toes to understand exactly what's going on. I often end up going around in circles even when I've just seconds before seen an option I now want to select. For example getting a security thing for the domain. It happens to be on its own option but I'd seen it somewhere else and couldn't then find it when I wanted to apply for a new domain.Further, when setting up password for FTP access, the whole process is simply wrong. Instead of inviting user to enter a new password, the only option is to Change. This makes no sense if you've not already set one up. And if you have other accounts, you start to think it's using same password from a different domain which it is not. Clicking Change and entering a NEW one then results in an absurdly long process. Should be 1 second but more like over a minute!Once set up, I believe everything works ok. Support is quick to respond and have resolved all issues so far which not all hosts do. Unfortunately DH falls short of 5 stars by my book, because the setup process and general maintenance options could be vastly improved. A lot of this simply comes down to rethinking the whole dashboard, doing some user research with actual customers, and asking how to improve the experience.I suppose the problem in my case is I'm not a daily visitor to DH dashboard. If I was I'd probably fathom the whole thing and understand all of the quirks to the point of being indifferent to them. But I'd guess a lot of DH customers are people who set up a single site and are therefore infrequent users.I plan to continue with DH but as usability is such a big deal and DH have a massive population of customers, then I'd expect them to invest effort into either improving the UI, or offering at least two levels. Oh and some additional functionality like multiple FTP accounts; not rocket science.

I signed up to utilize the WordPress managed hosting, DreamPress.  On the face on things this seemed like a great services. On a positive note, virtual servers are fast SSD based, they allow you non root ssh access, they have disabled a swap, MySQL is held on a managed server and the price point is about right, On the flip side: - Customer support can be slow and at times very frustrating. You can only reach the team via a message board and on occasions messages marked as high priority are not pickup up for over 24 hours.  The technical abilities of the support team members varies greatly, they seem  to employ a round robin approach to support queries, therefore when you send a reply the next support again has little clue on what the previous agent might have done. Some agents are super stars others are black holes and are to be avoided. - With the DreamPress service they employ a varnish cache, which can cause more trouble than it's worth with caching some ajax requests etc.. and this can not be disabled.  - When signing up you don't get a temporary domain to use, so migrating your live site can be challenging to minimize downtime. Overall good but when your sites down you just want to speak to an agent to fix the problem.
Email has delayed arrival issues.  They eventually get to me but not on a consistent basis.

Review.Titre: Don't really interact with them that…
Review.Contenu: Don't really interact with them that much.  But things seem to be okay.

Review.Contenu: Hopefully next time will improve the speed in my country.

I have been with DreamHost for about two months now. First, I will start with the positives: 1.Signing up and adding domains in a breeze. The custom control panel is pretty good, once you get used to it (though it could do with a facelift). 2.Uptime is excellent. I have had consistent 99.9+% uptime for both my sites. 3.Support is fast and prompt, both via email and Twitter (except when it isn't, but more on this later). 4.Cloudflare Railgun for free on wen hosting accounts! 5.Excellent integration with Cloudflare and Google PageSpeed (more on Cloudflare later) 6.The servers have SSDs, so your website should technically load faster. So, all in all DreamHost is pretty good! BUT, there are some really big issues that I *hope* DreamHost will fix soon. Here they are, 1.Response times of both my websites are consistently >0.2s, 0.2s being the upper threshold that Google PageSpeed Insights recommends for quick loading websites. This was never an issue with my previous host - JustHost, even though they used rotating HDDs and DreamHost uses SSDs. DreamHost's response to it was basically, "meh, can't help. Upgrade to VPS or DreamPress." 2.The development team is an absolute nightmare. Here's the thing. A couple of weeks after signing up, I turned on Cloudflare Plus ($10/mo) for one of my domains. Two of the best features of this plan are image lazy loading (Mirage) and image compression (Polish). But for some reason, neither feature worked on my website. After a bit of hunting around, I found that these features were getting automatically disabled from DreamHost's panel. I immediately contacted support and asked them to fix it, because I was being billed for Cloudflare Plus. Turned out the support team couldn't fix the bug, so they transferred it to the development team. That was back in the first week of May, a FULL MONTH AGO. I am yet to hear from the dev team. There is no known way of contacting them - you can only ask the support team about the status, and they have literally no idea when or if the dev team will fix the issue.    I still like DreamHost and will continue to host with them for the remaining period of my current cycle, but they really need to tame that wild dev team and fix whatever is keeping the response times down, or else I am a goner.

Review.Titre: Mixed Reliability & Mixed support quality - Great Potential
Review.Contenu: The hosting products they offer are excellent in potential - but it is clear that their VPS' are not well tuned and optimised. Sfter much of the usual teeth gnashing & "analysis" They initially blamed the  Wordpress plugins the wordpress Themes the amount of content me for wanting hosting support.Father Xmasa passing dolphin.... ....but in fairness  I have discovered this lazy passing-the-parcel in several hosts I have used in the past - including those who also claimed to be award winning "Wordpress" specialists - so I was frustrated but not entirely surprised. I guess I was charmed by the promotional "cuddliness" on their website [which I love btw - so its my own fault] Moved sites to Dreampress 2 Hosting without changing anything and discovered none of these excuses were true. But heyho - such is the web hosting space everywhere despite the lofty ambition of the Founders often collapses under the weight of incompetent poorly briefed tech support Resumes! The Dreampress product is on the face of it excellent in terms of its compatibility with running Wordpress & promise & composition and promise - but so far we have found several server settings which crash under minor stress giving error 503s/418 The support tries hard but is mixed at best in terms of resolving the issues above. The Chat support is staffed with widely mixed abilities [like all hosts to be fair] and the escalation very slow - it has often taken several days for the second line to get back in touch. You tend to get pushed from one to the other which is intensely irritating. Still everyone is plugged in cheery - which does not make up for the lack of resolution - but they try.....however in the mean time your traffic is being stuffed. When they work the hosting speeds and performance are excellent. The pricing is very competitive. The scalability of the hosting is very attractive. I should think that they perform very well for sites smaller than ours - even though they claim to be able to handle larger databases. This is really more an ambition than it is a reality - since it is clear that the larger sites suffer under load. If they could get this right at a optimised server level - the DreamPress could be truly fantastic value for money. But like all hosting there is a shortage of MySql Tuning expertise in this space. One more push and they could be great. 6-8-2015 - Update I have been experiencing server error 503 issues with 3 sites for 2 weeks and have had a ticket about the matter open for the last 4 days awaiting a fix. It seems as if the servers are not configured correctly - which should be a very basic issue to resolve for a web host. To re-iterate - the smaller sites we have hosted experience no such problems - hence there is a direct correlation between the increased size of the hosted content and the number of server crashes. There is a continued resistance to understand this relationship....and the required server tuning. We joined with Dreamhost because of their claim that the DreamPress 2 service can handle larger databases AND they understand Wordpress.There is clearly a flaw in this offer from my experience and I am keen to work through a solution before exploring my options. I have had another Ticket outstanding for 13 days. Clearly the response from Dreamhost contradicts what has been said below.

When I was first with Dreamhost - support was solid, hosting was steady, uptime was good. The UI was luxurious, and they really felt like they'd hold a high position in the world of consumer and freelancer centric hosting companies.I normally don't write reviews, especially negative ones, but I have had a relationship with this company for far too long to just ghost them. This is my opinion from my experiences with them, and you may have a different relationship. -IN FACT- I saw a review from someone else who started with them in 2001 (same year as me) that has a 5 star review with opposing points!tl;dr - if you're looking to host a simple site, a couple email addresses, buy a domain, and have a CDN - all in one spot - and need something that looks prettier than CPanel but has a similar disjointed UX - Dreamhost can do that, but I don't feel the bang for the buck is there (comparing to others). If you need multiple sites, want to use platforms like Wordpress (without investing in the Dreampress plans), or just do anything more than what was first mentioned, they're not a good fit.I have been with Dreamhost for over 15 years. I've migrated clients to them. I have set friends and family up with accounts. I've hosted many personal sites with them. I've seen their changes in guard, newsletters, and company voice. Mostly, I've been subject to it being less about a dream, and more about sleeping on the job. About five years ago, it was cemented with me that I could not host any site that needed consistent uptime with them. Low traffic, "address and phone number" type website for a friends business, sure. Nephew's programming project, absolutely. Ecommerce - no way. Any client site, absolutely not (even comparing dreampress to dedicated WP hosts - comparing apples to apples here).For the entire time I have been with Dreamhost there were regular jokes by customers about needing to move their hosting to whoever Dreamhost uses for Dreamhoststatus.com - the only site that seems to have reliable uptime. Uptime is a difficult word to argue, while a site may be "servable" Dreamhost has gotten extremely aggressive about 500 Server errors - which, to me, means downtime.Why I have spent the past two years looking for other hosting options (that's why they're not marked "BAD" - I found worse), and the last two months migrating everyone and everything I've put with DreamHost away to other options:- Their proprietary control panel used to be something that helped them stand out in a positive way. Now, it's clunky. It's limiting, and that panel has moved away from customer service and account maintenance to sales tools and discouraging migrating away. It makes sense for their business, just not for the customer.- They used to be the cheap place to get a domain. They're not even competitive anymore.- They used to be fast, now I can expect 500 server errors just installing Wordpress themes - much less for editing sites.- They are behind the times in features like backups, malware protection, and staging sites- 500 errors and downtime- Stingy and secretive with resources, which makes sense for shared hosting, but is probably what causes all the downtime - and maybe there are too many shares on a single server, I don't know. I didn't even know that this was a thing until I started working with and trialing other hosts.Pros:- Their Cloudflare integration is solid/better than CPanel native one.- The UI is still pretty. (If you use CPanel, you'll hate it - nothing is "where it should be" - if you hate CPanel, you'll love it)- Domain Management is easy.- I've NEVER had a billing dispute nor grievance with them.I think Dreamhost is trying to be all things to everyone, and not accomplishing that. I feel that if Dreamhost can decide who their customer is, they can get their product in line and thrive again. *When I started, it felt like a consumer-accessible hosting company that would grow with you - and the ethical player that would end godaddy; now it's too tough for the little guy (and too much money), and too feature weak for real customers.
So far, so good. Self help support isn't great, but the human support has been fantastic. Chatbot is worthless.Brand new so I can't comment on more. Control panel is acceptable.

DreamHost is generally wonderful, and their support team is great!I wasn't crazy about their marketing for DreamPress which didn't warn me that I would have to manage quite a lot. The marketing made it sound automated. Not the case!

Review.Titre: Costly billing snafu resolved in 1 day
Review.Contenu: There was a billing snafu resulting in me owing around $900 which was far in excess of the cost of the services I was actually using. Dreamhost responded quickly and had the whole thing straightened out in a day!
It is a great company, sometimes when getting some help, it may take a while.
Web-site looked good. Attention to detail with phone numbers and address was the only issue but easily fixed.

Within a reasonable time I was able to get chat help with my problem and we were able to work together chatting through matters  and making progress to a solution, exchanging screenshots where necessary. The process was iterative and continuing in a logical manner till the solution was arrived at. Near the end he took a bit of time out to get technical help and that happened quickly. I have used their help a few times now over the years and this experience is consistent.
Almost perfect customer support for Shared, VPS and Dedicated plans. Please do not expect immediate reply and action. It takes about half an hour.

I have been a customer of their Shared Hosting since 2009 - 14 years! - and found this to be the best balance between service and cost. Plenty of features (Generous disk space, MySQL, CronJobs, self-signed SSL certs, unlimited emails, shell access, one-click installs) Support team is very responsive and overall competent. I've hosted a few professional eCommerce portals without any major issues. The reason why I departed and why they don't get a 5-star: significant price increases for renewals over the years, slight drop in service quality, and an attempt to charge me for a service I didn't ask for. After moving my professional high-traffic websites elsewhere and leaving only the smaller ones, that resulted in that for my use case DreamHost became too expensive. Still, even if they're not for me, overall they are the best managed hosting service I ever worked with.

Review.Titre: I have been using Dreamhost for Over 20…
Review.Contenu: I have been using Dreamhost for Over 20 years. I signed up with them for my first account in 2003, and have used them for some of my hosting for that whole time - about 30 sites currently. I have virtual private servers for www and mysql. Their hosting isn't the highest performance, and their support isn't the best ever, but both are solid and reliable. If you want a great value in above average hosting, Dreamhost is a great choice. It's definitely better than Bluehost, host gator, and the majority of hosting oversellers. To get better hosting, you need to go to a specialist level of hosting.

The folks at DreamHost are dedicated to doing an excellent job!  They spent a great deal of time with me to make sure my website was updated with the proper theme.  They were also very patient in explaining the details to me.  Customer service was always very prompt.

Review.Titre: Excellent tech support. But know what to ask for.
Review.Contenu: I recently migrated a medium-sized WordPress website (43 pages, 50 post. 400 images) from another hosting company to DreamHost. In general, the experience was very positive. There were a few glitches, but they were due to my lack of familiarity with the process than any failures on the part of the technical staff.Knowing what I know now, it would have been best for me to pay a relatively small fee to have the staff manage the set-up of a test site for me to review the migrated files, then after I OK'd it, to activate the live site. As I felt I could manage the whole thing without incurring additional costs, It took me about 10 back-and-forth tickets and a few days, to make this happen. The tech staff were always helpful and responsive. But in hindsight, I should have paid $100 to let them manage the whole process.  The choice of best path depends on the individual user and their technical abilities.

Review.Titre: Would have been perfect had it been…
Review.Contenu: Would have been perfect had it been noted I was working with an M-F crew.  But once the weekend was over, they rocked the work as their first priority followed up with me, and helped address the 2 issues I had with their restore work quickly!  Many thanks!

The team was responsive. They didn't always meet my expectations on the first try but they were enthusiastic to get it right. My only suggestion would be to assign only one point of contact. My updates would come from a rotating group of team leaders and it became confusing at one point.

When I finally got in touch with customer service they were very helpful for the most part. Once I get a few last small charges removed from my history then it will be 5 star. Thanks again from a long time customer.

I had lots of issues with WordPress and my website, DreamHost came to the rescue. The DreamHost team were absolutely fantastic and help me to the end. The replies to questions were quite fast in coming back albeit different staff to answer them. I am no Techie but the DreamHost staff treated me with courtesy, respect, honesty, and not forgetting their professionalism. After many years being with DreamHost I can only give them 4 stars, the fifth star was lost when I found out that my website was hosted with another company.  The company only works office hours Mon-Fri-0830_1700 which is no good to anyone who has a business to run and encounters difficulties looking for answers. Now I have to wait until the office opens to find out if my website is lost OR alive. I am praying for the latter.

When my extensive legacy website, wrapped in WordPress, needed rebuilding, I turned to DreamHost. Sergio reviewed my needs, then Vishal began the lengthy transition process and Megha recognized needed structural changes and completed the process with the help of their behind the scenes team. My situation was complex and I appreciate the attention to detail. At every point they were highly responsive and professional. The renovated site is functioning well and, with minimal ongoing help, I can maintain it. Many thanks to the DreamHost team for a job well done!

Review.Titre: I'm very happy with Dreamhost in…
Review.Contenu: I'm very happy with Dreamhost in general. The recent experience with the Wordpress security update was...pretty good. It seemed a little disorganized. The emails seemed to come from unofficial accounts, they didn't come from one person consistently, and some of the messages seemed to contradict other messages.  I honestly thought several of them were spam at first because the signature and format was so minimal and I get lots of fake "dreamhost" messages. I still don't really understand what the service was, but I trust dreamhost that it was necessary and done correctly.All correspondence was cordial, prompt and friendly-- I appreciated that :)

Review.Contenu: Great customer service via email. VERY HELPFUL AGENTS tackling all issues with efficiency. However, the live chat at DreamHost NEVER WORKS, and to talk to them on the phone, you can only do so via a callback (which is not a good option if you are very busy, working or tending to your personal stuff) and it costs 10 dollars! So, while I am satisfied with the help of the representatives that assisted e today, I am disappointed email seems to be the only way to get support. This was a KEY issue for me when I decided to change web hosting providers. My first question was regarding support, and I was told about the live chat, and phone support, but the chat does not work, and it was not explained to me, phone calls incur in extra charges.

These guys are amazing. Thats all I can say. I mean I wish they were a bit cheaper for the VPS server, but the customer service is 5 stars. World Class. The interface is simple. Prolific tutorials to read up on. They can't solve every issue under the sun with me cuz I use a custom built website. But I have to say, I have no complaints after doing business with them for over a year. I feel if there is an issue. They'll fix it very soon. They even help me with Cloudflare which is another friggen company. Plus! They aren't censored in China! Always a bonus. They are the Go-to for internet hosting. I'd give them 5 but I think the prices could be a bit lower.

Review.Titre: 10+ year customer, mildly frustrated with how Dreamhost handles difficult tickets
Review.Contenu: I've been using Dreamhost for more than a decade.  They asked me to write a review after a recent support ticket was resolved.Dreamhost's team is typically very quick to respond and simple issues are quickly resolved.  This time around, I had a complex issue (a firewall update broke our support system) and Dreamhost's customer support strategy backfired somewhat.  Their system ensures a quick response to your inquiries by moving support cases to representatives who can respond within an hour or two.  In this case, I ended up speaking to about 20 different representatives over the course of two months, each of whom had to go get themself up-to-date on a complicated issue.  Eventually the ticket was escalated -- some kind of exception was made so that I could have a slower (12-24 hour response time) conversation but with the same representative.  This person was able to get the full details and resolve the problem.  I just wish it hadn't taken so long to get to that point.

Review.Titre: There's a reason I've been with them for 10+ years!
Review.Contenu: Prompt responses, kind and patient help, and specialized feedback according to my familiarity with the issues. I continue to be happy with Dreamhost for its services and its staff. Thank you!

I would award the team 5 stars, if there were not an initial miscommunication between the customer service / programming teams. Nusrat is an excellent communicator and a delight to work with, providing all you could wish for in a collaboration - smart, intuitive, responsive, and personable. A real star.
We were able to have what seemed like an impossible dream come true.  Although I haven't begun to work on the changes we need I feel confident that it is attainable.

DreamHost has proven to be a reliable, customer-focused hosting provider that goes the extra mile to ensure a positive experience for their users. From seamless website performance to excellent customer support, they've ticked all the boxes for me. I wholeheartedly recommend DreamHost to anyone in need of top-notch hosting services.

Review.Titre: DreamHost gets you there in the end
Review.Contenu: I hired DreamHost Professional Services to migrate my website from Wordpress.com to Wordpress.org. I got everything I had hoped for by the end, and the two guys who worked with me—Abhay and Vishal—were extremely responsive, checking in with me every step of the way and answering my questions patiently. What would have earned a 5-star review from me is clearer communication up front from DreamHost about the whole process. It involved several steps that resulted in strange, unexpected things popping up in my DreamHost panel, with no clarification that these things were only temporary. Also, the Dreamhost bot generated automated emails that sent me false information, such as telling me I needed to create a new password by following a link, which did not work, and then when I asked about this, I was told to ignore the email. It would be better if the email wasn't sent—or if DreamHost drafted up a primer for the customer that outlined the steps to be expected, including the one where an email would appear that you should ignore. The DreamHost guys knew exactly what they were doing, and they competently accomplished the task in the end—but for several days I was wondering if something had gone bad at DreamHost, like what's happening over at the bird site. Thankfully, this is not at all true, and I'm thrilled to now have all my domains and websites over at Dreamhost. I remain a fan.
